title: borrowed_character
body:
When an artist draws an [[original]] character which was originally created by a different artist.

If an artist draws his own original character(s) with the borrowed character(s), or draws borrowed character(s) from more than one artist, also tag [[crossover]].

This also cover works where artist draws a stolen original character from another artist, where artist copied the design of other artist's OC and labelled as their own. In this case, tag that said original character with the name given by the original artist.

Note that "描いてもいいのよ":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/描いてもいいのよ is not supposed to indicate a borrowed character. It is supposed to be used to indicate the original artist is fine with others drawing their character. 

h4. See also

* [[borrowed design]]
* pool #1338 (Popular Artists Draw Other Copyrights)
other_names: 描かせていただきました

title: impossible_clothes
body:
Clothing that is unrealistically [[skin tight]], especially between and beneath the [[breasts]]. Normal clothing does not hug the [[breasts]] on all sides. Impossible clothing hugs the body in ways that normal clothing could never do.

Although this is most commonly seen with [[breasts]], it may also occur with other body parts (post #352925).

See [[tight clothes]] or [[skin tight]] for clothing that is very tight, but not unrealistically so.

The Japanese term is 乳袋 ([i]chichi-bukuro[/i], lit. "breasts sack").

h4. Examples

title: tteoguji
body: Traditional Korean headdress worn during the [[Joseon Dynasty]]. Worn by queens and crown princesses for formal attire. It resembles two large hair rings, of which flop over the scalp diagonally. It is one of many styles of carved-wood wig ornaments in Korea, called gache (加髢). It was usually made from paulownia, a lightweight wood, and engraved with braid patterns. h5. External Links "Google Arts and Culture: Tteo-guji, Wooden Wig":[https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/tteo-guji-wooden-wig-unkown/JwGC9ZnHIoBmkw?hl=en]

title: jacques_schnee
body:
A major antagonist of [[rwby|RWBY]]. CEO of the Schnee Dust Company, along with being the husband of [[Willow Schnee|]] and the father of [[Weiss Schnee|]], [[Winter Schnee|]] and [[Whitley Schnee|]]. A callous and manipulative businessman, his amoral actions have given the company a bad reputation and driven his wife into alcoholism. He is the arch-enemy to Weiss, who actively works to restore the previous and better reputation of the company.

[spoilers]In Volume 7, Jacques wins the election for councilman after rigging the votes, with help from [[Arthur Watts|]]. However, his treachery is found and revealed by his own daughter and Jacques is arrested for his crimes. During the conclusion of Volume 8, he is murdered by [[James Ironwood]].[/spoilers]

title: cinder_fall
body:
A major antagonist in the Rooster Teeth series [[RWBY]].

h4. Abilities
Cinder can produce and control fire. She also wields a variety of weapons including [[sword]]s, a [[bow]] and a [[spear]].

h4. Physical characteristics
Cinder is 5'11" tall including high heels. She has [[black hair]] and [[yellow_eyes|amber eyes]]. [spoiler]After suffering major injury at the end of Volume 3, she is thereafter missing an [[missing_limb|arm]] and an [[one-eyed|eye]] and has a large [[scar_on_face|scar]] on the left side of her face. [/spoiler]

h4. Attire
Cinder's outfit varies from volume to volume, but is usually red and black with gold decorations.

h4. External links
* "RWBY Wikia: Cinder Fall":https://rwby.fandom.com/wiki/Cinder_Fall

title: nora_valkyrie
body:
Nora Valkyrie is a supporting character in [[RWBY]], a 3DCG series produced by Rooster Teeth.

Nora is a member of Team JNPR, and is the "N" in the team's name. She is highly energetic and has a bouncy, cheerful personality. Her design and abilities are inspired by Thor.

h4. Abilities 

Nora wields [[Magnhild]], a weapon that can transform between a large two-handed hammer and a revolver-action grenade launcher. Her symbol is a hammer with a lightning bolt through it. Her semblance (special ability) allows her to absorb electrical energy and convert it to a temporary strength boost.

h4. Physical characteristics

Nora is short (5' 1") and curvy, and has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] and greenish eyes.

[spoiler]As of volume 8 episode 3, her arms and upper body are covered in [[Lichtenberg figure]]-shaped scars.[/spoiler]

h4. Attire

Nora usually wears pink and white clothing accented with black and/or blue. In addition to her hammer and lightning symbol, her outfits often incorporate one or more heart-shaped designs. Most of her outfits include a short skirt.

h4. External links

https://rwby.fandom.com/wiki/Nora_Valkyrie

title: felicia_(darkstalkers)
body:
[[Cat girl]] character from the [[Darkstalkers]] fighting game series.

Felicia was raised by a Catholic nun named Rose. When Rose died, Felicia left her town hoping to be a musical star. During her travels, she met many other catgirls of her kind. With her newfound friends, she set out for her dream of being on stage. Eventually, she and her friends started a musical with Felicia being the main star. She has [[big hair|voluminous]] [[blue hair]], [[white fur]], [[cat ears]], and a [[cat tail]].

h4. External links

* "Capcom Database: Felicia":http://capcom.wikia.com/wiki/Felicia

title: q-bee
body:
A character from the [[Darkstalkers]] series.

Leader of the Soul Bees and Character in Capcom's Vampire/Darkstalker series.

She premiered in [b]Vampire Savior/Darkstalkers 3[/b], and is noted for her Homing Airdash being a very powerful tool. Uses a variety of moves highlighting her bee nature, including ES C->R, which Coccoons the enemy and a daughter hatches from it, +B, a move where she covers the foes in bees, and QJ, which coats the foe in a bubble of honey, preventing movement.

[b]Soul Bees[/b] are very simillar to Earth bees as far as Sex Roles and Society. The [[compound eyes]] and [[Antennae]] are the primary sensory organs. [b]Soul Bees[/b] take on a humanlike form and can mate with most creatures, as well as lure prey. A [b]Soul Bee[/b]'s intellect is comperable to a human 5 year old, and are driven heavily on instinct. Soul Bees are carnivorous and can eat niegh anything, dying if no food is consumed in 48 hours.

In story, the [b]Soul Bees[/b] inhabit the Doma lands of Makai, which has become barren over the years. When [[Jedah Dohma]] returns from death, they align with him to collect souls in exchange for being able to eat freely. In [[Q-Bee]]'s ending, she betrays [[Jedah Dohma]] to her instincts to eat, and the [b]Soul Bee[/b] population explodes, threatening overpopulation causing extinction.

[[Q-Bee]] also appears as Cards in the SVC: Card Fighters' Clash series, an enemy unit in NamcoXCapcom, and various [[Darkstalkers]] Adaptations in roles of various significance.

Not to be confused with the [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] character [[Kyubey]].

She is voiced by [i]Matsushita Miyuki[/i], but the only sounds the character makes are buzzes.

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Q-Bee

title: svc_chaos
body:
Otherwise known as [b]SNK vs. Capcom: SVC Chaos[/b] or [b]SVC Chaos: SNK vs. Capcom[/b], this game is a crossover between SNK's [[The King of Fighters]], [[Ryuuko no Ken]] (Art of Fighting), [[Fatal Fury]], [[Samurai Spirits]] (Samurai Shodown), [[Athena (series)|]] and [[Metal Slug]] with Capcom's [[Street Fighter]], [[Warzard]] (Red Earth), [[Darkstalkers]] (Vampire), [[Mega Man (series)|]], and [[Makaimura]] (Ghosts'n Goblins'). The SNK-produced portion of the [i][[Capcom vs SNK|Capcom vs. SNK]][/i] series.

When a player gets hit by one of [[Demitri Maximoff]]'s supers, he will briefly enter a state called "[[Midnight Bliss]]". When the player is defeated by [[Princess Athena]], he will become an animal. On the other hand, when the player is defeated by [[Red Arremer]], he will become a demon.

h4.External links
* "SNK Wiki: SNK vs. Capcom: SVC Chaos":https://snk.fandom.com/wiki/SNK_vs._Capcom:_SVC_Chaos

title: jedah_dohma
body:
[b]Jedah Dohma (ジェダ・ドーマ)[/b] is a [[Darkstalkers]] character who first debuted in [b]Vampire Savior: The Lord of Vampire (a.k.a. Darkstalkers 3)[/b].

He is a Demon from Makai and is over 6000 years old, he is the youngest out of the three High nobles of Makai. He was always concerned about the future of Makai. He believed that if Makai was left to rule by Belial, the master of the Aensland family and the true ruler of Makai, then it would fall into chaos. Belial would most likely say that is destiny and life. To Jedah, Belial was a being who is not fit to rule. He looked for an opportunity to destroy Belial and waited for the right time to strike as a means to control the realm for himself. 

After a century long sleep, Jedah was revived in Makai. He felt concern towards the realm Makai, with nobles fighting each other. Instead of anger, he felt pity towards Ozomu. Jedah had already made up his mind: his complete revival and the cleansing of all souls. For this, a new stage was necessary. A new realm, the Majigen.

title: kimoto_takenori
body:
Takenori Kimoto is a charater and effect designer involved with [[Capcom]] since Super [[Street Fighter II (series)|]] Turbo, for which he served as a planner. He is, however, more notable for his work on the [[Darkstalkers]] series, where he designed [[Anakaris]]. Other work includes One Piece Mansion, Apollo Justice: Ace Attorney and the cancelled Mega Man Universe.

He is mainly known by his alias, Kimo Kimo.

title: puzzle_fighter
body: A one or two player tile-matching puzzle video game first released in the spring of 1996 by [[Capcom]] on the CPS II arcade system, otherwise known as [b]Super Puzzle Fighter II: Turbo[/b] ([b]Super Puzzle Fighter II: X[/b] in Japan). The game's title is a [[parody]] of [[Street Fighter II (series)|Street Fighter II Turbo]] (or Super Street Fighter II X in Japan), with music and interface elements spoofing the [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero]] and [[Darkstalkers]] games.

title: chainsaw_man
body:
A Japanese manga series written and illustrated by [[Fujimoto Tatsuki]] that ran in [[Shounen Jump]] from January 2019 to January 2021 and has a sequel that began serialization on July 13, 2022  for Jump+. There is a Fall 2022 anime adaptation by MAPPA.

Set in a world where humans coexists with devils, who are born from humanity's fear. The series focus on [[Denji (Chainsaw Man)|]], an impoverished man who formed a contract with the devil [[Pochita (Chainsaw Man)|]], transformed him into the [[Chainsaw Devil]] i.e the titular "Chainsaw Man".

title: fake_blood
body:
A substance that appears to be [[blood]], but isn't - in color artworks, commonly [[ketchup]], [[red bean paste]], [[jam]] or [[paint]]; though monochrome ones might also use other substances, like [[chocolate]].

Not every instance of a red fluid is necessarily faux blood - look for crazed expressions, knives, signs of "injuries", or people [[playing dead|lying lifelessly]] on the floor (with the source of "blood" visible).

h4. See also
* [[Ambiguous red liquid]] - when it cannot be determined if the liquid is blood or not

title: playing_dead
body:
When someone pretends to be [[death|dead]].

If used as a [[prank]], may be accompanied by [[fake blood]], knives, or signs of "injury".

title: iyagatteru_kimi_ga_suki
body:
Ongoing webcomic based on [[oniyama831|Oniyama Mizuki]]'s [i][[Sonna Futari wa Tsukiatteiru]][/i] series of comics.
Roughly translated title: [i]To The Hateful You, I Like You.[/i]

Ootsuki Makoto confesses his feelings to Shirakawa Mikoto, and the two begin dating.

[spoiler]A story of mutual exploitation with multiple victims. Iyagatteru Kimi Ga Suki explores various fringe paraphilias and the psychology of the characters in detail as their most depraved feelings are exposed(while keeping things classy).[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Its prevailing spirit is an exploration of[i] a perversion of romantic emotions,[/i] rather than crass fringe sexual perversion for perversion's sake.[/spoiler]


80s styled [spoiler]arguably horror[/spoiler] romance written in the modern era [spoiler]with grotesque (guro) elements.[/spoiler]

Absolutely not your conventional [i]shoujo[/i] love story. Filled with dark and ironic humor.

[spoiler][i]How deep does the rabbit hole go?[/i][/spoiler]
other_names: 嫌がってるキミが好き
喜欢的就是一脸嫌恶的你

title: midnight_bliss
body:
The [b]Midnight Bliss[/b] ([b]ミッドナイトブリス[/b]) is a special move used by [[Demitri Maximoff]] from the [[darkstalkers|Vampire/Darkstalkers]] seires.

Demitri glides forward, tosses a rose at the opponent, transforms them into a hapless maiden ([b]including male characters![/b]), bows before them, holds them in the air, and then drains the life energy out of the opponent.

The move was very popular in the original game, but became even more popular when Demitri was put in [[SVC Chaos]] which forced the development team to make [[genderswap|genderswapped]] sprites for the male characters both from [[SNK]] and [[Capcom]]. A few years later Demitri was included in the roster for [[Capcom Fighting Jam]] which should be no surprise as to what happens next after that.

The move's name is also used a common tag on [[pixiv]] for genderswapping male characters that have or come from an official fighting game, or for drawing female characters as they are depicted from the original fighting games when under the effect of the Midnight Bliss.

h4. Midnight Bliss compilation videos

* [[darkstalkers|Vampire/Darkstalkers]]: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aOPNAB4C_uQ (Video was made private!)
* Darkstalkers Revenge: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eJls2jI6WHA
* Darkstalkers Resurrection: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ux_TzeaEAPk
* [[SVC Chaos]]: YouTube "Video 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iEZCqQLWznk and "Video 2":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sJtIk9z7TN0
* [[Capcom Fighting Jam|Capcom Fighting Evolution]]: YouTube "Video 1":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n2Lfg1NkPdk and "Video 2":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dAlSdsBDnJ8

title: len'en
body:
Len'en (鏈縁 or 連縁, lit. "Connecting Chain") is a series of vertical [[danmaku]] shooting games made by [[jynx (trick nostalgie)|JynX]], set in the land of Mugenri. Although inspired by [[Touhou]] and [[Seihou]], the games are not Touhou fangames. They are set in a separate world featuring an entirely new cast of characters.

Also of note is that while in Touhou the characters are all female, in Len'en [[androgynous|the characters' genders are generally left ambiguous.]] It is likely that their genders will never be revealed, and that it will simply be up to the player's interpretation. Most of the characters have names that reference birds.

h4. Games

* 鏈縁 无現里 (Len'en Mugenri) ～ [[Evanescent Existence]] 
* 鏈縁 蛇叢釼 (Len'en Tasouken) ～ [[Earthen Miraculous Sword]] 
* 鏈縁霊烈傳 (Len'en Reiretsuden) ～ [[Reactivate Majestical Imperial]] 
* 連縁天影戦記 (Len'en Teneisenki) ～ [[Brilliant Pagoda or Haze Castle]]
* 連縁カフェ (Len'en Cafe) ～ [[BOOK of the CAFE]]

title: vinyl_scratch
body:
An extra character from [[My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic]].

A white unicorn with bright blue hair and sunglasses also known as DJ Pon3.

Most fan art of her depict her with bright [[red eyes]], but her first appearance without her glasses was in lighting that made her eyes appear [[purple eyes|purple]]. 

Fans tend to pair her with [[Octavia Melody]] because of their wildly divergent personalities and musical tastes, and they were seen living together in the background pony-oriented hundredth episode.

title: huevocartoon
body: Huevocartoon is a Mexican multimedia entertainment brand and animation studio founded in November 2001 by Gabriel and Rodolfo Riva Palacio Alatriste, Carlos Zepeda Chehaibar, and Rodolfo Riva Palacio Velasco. It consists of an internet series, six feature films, a video game, a television special, and advertisements, featuring anthropomorphic eggs in a civilized and humorous setting.

Picket fences are particularly popular in North America among suburban [[house|homes]], especially white ones.

title: star_trek:_the_next_generation
body:
Star Trek: The Next Generation (TNG) is an American science fiction television series created by Gene Roddenberry. It originally aired from September 28, 1987, to May 23, 1994, in syndication, spanning 178 episodes over seven seasons. The third series in the [[Star Trek]] franchise, it was inspired by [[Star Trek: The Original Series]]. Set in the latter third of the 24th century, when Earth is part of the United Federation of Planets, it follows the adventures of a Starfleet starship, the [[USS Enterprise]] (NCC-1701-D), in its exploration of the Alpha quadrant in the Milky Way galaxy.

The Next Generation featured a new crew: [[Patrick Stewart]] as Captain [[Jean-Luc Picard]], Jonathan Frakes as [[William Riker]], Brent Spiner as Data, Michael Dorn as [[worf (star trek)|Worf]], LeVar Burton as [[Geordi La Forge]], Marina Sirtis as [[Deanna Troi]], Gates McFadden as Dr. [[Beverly Crusher]], Denise Crosby as Tasha Yar, Wil Wheaton as Wesley Crusher, and a new Enterprise.

Source: Wikipedia.

title: sturmabteilung
body:
[i]Sturmabteilung[/i] (German for "Storm Division") was the original paramilitary wing of the [[Nazi|Nazi Party]] that played a significant role in [[Adolf Hitler]]'s rise to power in 1920s and 1930s. Its members were largely purged and their leader [[ernst julius roehm|Ernst Röhm]], was executed during the Night of the Long Knives, superseded by the [[Waffen-SS|Schutzstaffel]] despite SA continued to exist until 1945.

The SA were colloquially called Brownshirts ([i]Braunhemden[/i]) due to the color of their uniform's shirts.

h4. Uniform and insignia
Their standard [[uniform]] consisted of a [[kepi]], [[brown shirt|brown]] [[collared shirt]] paired with a [[brown necktie]], [[brown jacket|brown]] [[military jacket]], [[Sam Browne belt]], [[brown pants]] or [[jodhpurs]], and a pair of [[boots]].
The SA [[insignia]] consisted of a [[badge]] ([[Nazi party pin]]), [[collar tabs]], [[shoulder boards]], [[cuff title]], and the [[Iron Cross]]. The [[red armband|red]] party [[armband]] were often donned as well.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Sturmabteilung":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sturmabteilung

title: cossack
body:
A cossack a member of any of the groups that formed in [[Ukraine]], southern [[Russia]], the Caucasus, and Siberia after 1400 and were included in [[russian empire|tsarist Russia]] during the 18th and 19th centuries. Well-known of having adept [[warrior|fighting skills]] and semi-nomadic lifestyle.

This also apply to depictions of [[military uniform|military]] personnel serving in a unit drafted from Cossack communities.

title: russian_liberation_army
body:
The [b]Russian Liberation Army[/b] (German: [i]Russische Befreiungsarmee[/i]; Russian: Русская освободительная армия, abbreviated as РОА) was a pro-Axis [[military]] formation, primarily composed of [[Russia]]ns, that fought under German command during [[World War II]]. Active from 1942 until 1945, the [[soldier|army]] was led by a defected Soviet Army general, Andrey Vlasov.

The personnel were distinguishable by the [[shoulder patch]]es bearing the blue saltire on white background design of the [[St. Andrew's Flag]] (Russian Naval Jack), [[ushanka]]s, [[cockade]]s on [[military hat]]s that bear the white-blue-red [[russian flag|Russian tricolor]] or sometimes such stripes that were painted on their [[Stahlhelm]]e.

h4. See also
* [[cossack]]
* [[List of Armed Forces]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Russian Liberation Army":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Liberation_Army

title: floating_dock
body:
A floating dock is coastal/water structure composed of a platform kept afloat using pontoons and anchored, similar to a [[pier]] but is able to rise and lower with the tide.  May have a gangway used to connect it to the shore.

A structure built upon similar platforms are called a [[floating home]].

h4. See also

* [[Jetty]]
* [[Wharf]]
* [[Dock]]
* [[Harbor]]
* [[Port]]
* [[Ship]]

title: seawall
body:
A seawall is a coastal defense structure, a structure to protect against flooding and erosion, built along the coast.  May be as simple as large rocks and debris lining the coastline or it may be an actual wall built along the coast line.  In Japan [[tetrapod]]s are commonly used for seawalls.

h4. See also

* [[Breakwater]]
* "Wikipedia: Seawall":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seawall]

title: split_theme
body:
Multiple distinct (and usually opposite) themes being represented at the same time, with a [[split_theme|split]] between them as a way to represent contrast. 

The simplest way to do this is to have two opposite themes on each side with a clean split in the middle (see [[split screen]]).

Examples:

* Two different characters being portrayed as one (post #1318355)
* While a character is in the middle of a [[henshin]] transformation (post #1841349)
* Revealing the "true nature" of a character (post #6870337)
* Comparing how a character looked when they were younger to when they're older

h4. See Also
* [[juxtaposition]]
* [[polar opposites]]
* [[sword in front of face]]

title: breakwater
body:
A breakwater is a long coastal structure out in the water that runs parallel to the shore.  They're normal feature of man-made [[harbor]]s to break the force of the sea and to provide shelter for vessels lying inside.

h4. See also

* [[Seawall]]
* [[Tetrapod]]

title: pier
body:
A coastal structure composed of raised platforms supported by piles or posts, similar to a one-ended bridge extending out into the water.  May be used as a simple walkway, support structures over the water, or to moor ships and boats.  Commonly made of wood, but may also be made of other materials such as metal or stone.

h4. See Also

* [[Floating dock]]
* [[Jetty]]
* [[Wharf]]
* [[Dock]]
* [[Harbor]]
* [[Port]]
* [[Ship]]

title: wharf
body:
A solid coastal structure running along the coastline where boats and ships may moor.  May have [[pier]]s and [[jetty]] extending out into the water from them.

h4. See Also

* [[Floating dock]]
* [[Dock]]
* [[Harbor]]
* [[Port]]
* [[Ship]]

title: jetty
body:
A solid coastal structure typically composed of stone, fill, and/or wood that juts out into the water.  May be used to moor ships and boats or to alter the coastal current.  Unlike a [[pier]] these structures completely block the flow of water.

h4. See also

* [[Breakwater]]
* [[Floating dock]]
* [[Wharf]]
* [[Dock]]
* [[Harbor]]
* [[Port]]
* [[Ship]]
* [[Tag group:locations]]

title: tame_mene
body:
The song protagonist in [[Abnormality Dancin' Girl (vocaloid)|]], a song by Guchiry.

She has a abnormal obsession with the idea of being "abnormal."

She's a teenage girl with [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[purple eyes]] that become bumpy whenever she has a meltdown, and she has [[crossed bangs]] that form into an X. 

In her 1st outfit, she wears a [[school uniform]] which is a [[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] covered in a [[purple sweater]] with [[long sleeves]] [[sleeves_past_wrists|that can go past her wrists]], and a [[black necktie]]. She wears a short [[black skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[white footwear|white shoes]].

In her 2nd outfit, she wears an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[turtleneck]] [[black dress]]; over the dress is a [[grey shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]]. She wears [[black gloves]] and [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks]]. She also wears a purple [[hairclip]].

In her 3rd outfit, she no longer has eyebrows and her bangs are no longer crossed. She now has [[short twintails]] with a [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], her ahoge now resembles a butterfly's [[antenna hair|antennae]]. Her eyes are noticably [[crazy eyes|crazier]] and [[constricted pupils|constricted]] and wears a [[smile]]. Her outfit consists of a [[black choker]], a [[necklace]] with three purple circles with black centres with a proboscis in the middle. She wears a two-piece [[black bikini]] that shows her [[underboob]], a [[translucent]] [[black skirt]] that resembles the bottom of a butterfly's wings. She also wears [[translucent]] cloth on her arms which is connected in the middle of her bikini top. She wears torn [[black gloves]] and [[black footwear|black shoes]] that resemble wings. Her legs go from purple from the bottom and gradually disappear into her skin and finally, she wears six black [[hairclip]]s that resemble eyes onto her twintails.

title: chemical_structure
body:
A graphical representation of the [[chemistry|chemical]] compound's spatial arrangement of its atoms, molecular shape and often their chemical bonds. It comes in various models and can be either 2D or 3D. Unlike [[chemical formula]] which is limited to text.

For example, the chemical structure for water (H₂O) is a basic grid of one hydrogen molecule, one oxygen, and then another hydrogen. More complex substances thus require more complicated grids to outline every molecule present.

h4. Examples
* !post #4678960: Ball and stick model of the sulfur mustard.
* !post #362186: Skeletal structure of adenine with a benzene ring.

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "Chemical structure":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chemical_structure

title: chemical_formula
body:
A way of presenting information about the [[chemistry|chemical]] proportions of atoms that constitute a particular [[chemicals|chemical]] compound or molecule, using chemical element symbols, numbers, and sometimes also other symbols, such as parentheses, dashes, brackets, and plus (+) and minus (−) signs. Unlike [[chemical structure]], these are limited to a single typographic line of symbols, which may include subscripts and superscripts. 

For example, H₂O for [[water]] and C₇H₅N₃O₆ or C₆H₂(NO₂)₃CH₃ for [[tnt|trinitrotoluene]].

title: chemical_symbol
body:
To be used for posts that depict individual or assorted chemical symbols of certain elements. Not to be used for the whole [[periodic table]] or [[chemical formula]].

Some examples are H for hydrogen, Ag for silver ([i]argentum[/i]), Ba for barium, Br for bromine, and so on.


h4. See also
* [[chemistry]]
* [[chemical structure]]
* [[Tag Group:Text]]

Examples include [[Sakurazaki Setsuna]] from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]] and [[Misaka Mikoto]] and her variants from [[Toaru Majutsu no Index]].  

This tag should not be used for bangs asymmetric simply due to a part on one side, for that see either [[parted bangs]] or [[swept bangs]].

* [[diagonal bangs]] - For bangs that are cut in an odd diagonal line
* [[swept bangs]] - For bangs loosely combed to one side
* [[parted bangs]] - For distinctly parted bangs
* [[crossed bangs]] - For bangs that criss-cross each other on the forehead

title: m1911
body:
An American single-action, semi-automatic [[handgun]] designed by [[John Moses Browning]]. Its short-recoil operation with a reciprocating slide highly influenced modern pistol designs.

The [[M1911]] is visually identifiable by its external hammer, a beaver tail safety, both grip panels being held by two [[screw]]s and a thumb safety. Chambered for the .45 ACP [[cartridge]], the standard [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] capacity is seven rounds. In 1924, the M1911 was largely revised into the [B]M1911A1[/B], with a shorter trigger and a longer back spur. It was the standard sidearm of the [[United States|U.S.]] [[military]] from 1911 to 1985.

This tag applies to any M1911-styled handgun, regardless of specific model. 
h4. Reference images
* !post #6334159
* !post #765582: Custom M1911 with a skeletonized trigger.
h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M1911 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[M45 MEUSOC]]

title: casing_ejection
body:
The act of ejecting [[shell_casing|shell casings]] from a [[gun|firearm]]. Typically casings are ejected automatically from most modern self-loading [[weapon]]s after a [[ammunition|round]] is fired. 

However, this also applies to the act of manually ejecting casingsーsuch as by cocking the slide of a semi-automatic [[handgun]] or [[pump action]] [[shotgun]], as well as by opening the cylinder of a [[revolver]].
h4. Examples
* !post #7809228
* !post #7731087
* !post #61390: Manual ejection

title: roma_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian battleship [i]Roma[/i]. Character design by [[Chyoel]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow]] eyes. Her default outfit consists of a long [[white dress]] with a studded [[see-through dress|see-through]] outer layer, white [[detached sleeves]], a [[red cape]], a [[gold]] [[belt]] with a [[dagger]] attached to it, an [[Italian flag]] ribbon on the cape, a [[mini crown]], and other pieces of [[jewelry]] like [[bracelet]]s.

Her [[rigging]] is similar to [[Roma (Kancolle)|]] from [[Kantai Collection]], sporting two of her historic 381 mm triple mounts (one on each side) with additional 20 mm twin mounts atop the turrets, and two of her 152 mm triple mounts, all in rigs that display the [[Regia Marina]]'s historic red-white bow marks and shields that display the [[Sardegna Empire (emblem)|]] emblem. She is also shown carrying a gold [[staff]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5543778: Default
* !post #5674564: [[Roma (White Heron of Darkest Night) (Azur Lane)|White Heron of Darkest Night]]
* !post #7908742: [[Roma (Vacation Upon the Tiber) (Azur Lane)|Vacation Upon the Tiber]]

h4. History
Historically, she never saw much action due to chronic fuel shortages by the time she was commissioned in June 1942. Roma was sunk by the [[Luftwaffe]] in her only combat stint as she, her sister ships [[Vittorio Veneto (Azur Lane)|]] and [[Littorio (Azur Lane)|]], and other units in the Italian fleet that could sortie attempted to sail to Malta to surrender to the British in early September 1943.

h4. [i]Vittorio Veneto[/i]-class battleships

* [[Littorio (Azur Lane)|]]
* [[Impero (Azur Lane)|]] (converted to carrier)
* [b]Roma[/b]

* [[Roma (Warship Girls R)]]

title: timcanpy
body: Timcanpy is a small, golden ball-like creature with four, stubby legs, the front two of which he can form little "fingers" with, a long tail that ends in a thick swirl, and two feathered wings. A cross fleury adorns his "face", and above it are two small horns.

title: yande-kun
body:
An [[original]] character created by [[Pepoyo]].  

The older brother of [[Shinde-Chan]].

title: shinde-chan
body:
An [[original]] character created by [[Pepoyo]].  

The younger sister of [[Yande-Kun]].

title: kasumi_(senran_kagura)
body:
A playable character from the [[Senran Kagura]] videogame series. She makes her debut in [[Senran Kagura New Wave]]. A 3rd year at Prefectural Shinozuka Industrial High School. Excelling at information gathering, she aims to enter the Intelligence and Analysis team. She is very shy and hardly ever talks.

From her PC, she summons an electric-based persona which she indirectly manipulates to attack enemies.

Kasumi (霞) means "Mist" in Japanese.

title: ibara_mayaka
body:
Character from [[Hyouka]].

One of the four main characters of Hyōka. She is a student of Kamiyama High School, a volunteer librarian in school library and a member of Classics Club and Manga Club.

title: richie_(el_quijote)
body:
[[Original]] character by [[El Quijote]].

Richie is a joyful girl with an athletic body. She loves sports and cycling, plus she's an amazing cook. However, she's illiterate and her math skills are nonexistent.

title: idolmaster_side-m
body:
A mobile game spin-off of [[idolmaster|iDOLM@STER]] launched in 2014, this time focusing on producing for the male idols of the 315 Productions agency. 

The members of [[jupiter (idolmaster)|Jupiter]] from [[Idolmaster 2|iDOLM@STER 2]]'s 961 Productions are included in the roster, with Akizuki Ryou of [[idolmaster dearly stars|Dearly Stars]]' 876 Productions being added later as part of his own unit.

In March 2015, voices began to be introduced for the idols, starting with the unit DRAMATIC STARS. ST@RTING LINE, a series of music CDs featuring them and other units, also began to be released by Lantis throughout the year. 

In December 2015, a Twitter-based poll called the New Idol Discovery Project (新アイドル発掘オーディション) was run to select three new idols from a pool of nine candidates to form a new unit, with the winners being announced a month later. The winners (Amehiko, Koron, and Sora) were later implemented into the game in July 2016 as the idol group Legenders. The other six candidates have not been put into the game as of late.

In February 2017, Bandai Namco announced the development of [[idolmaster_side-m_live_on_stage!|The iDOLM@STER SideM Live on St@ge!]], a mobile spinoff. The game serves as a male counterpart to [[idolmaster_cinderella_girls_starlight_stage|Starlight Stage]], as it is a rhythm game utilizing 3D models of the 315 idols for in-game performances. They also announced a [i]SideM[/i] anime adaptation, with further details being revealed on "315 Day" (March 15). The anime premiered in the fall of 2017.

In 2021, a third game, [[idolmaster side-m growing stars|THE iDOLM@STER SideM GROWING STARS]], was announced following the closure of [i]LIVE ON ST@GE![/i].

title: pierre_bichelberger
body:
Member of the [[Idolmaster Side-M]] unit [[Beit_(idolmaster)|]]. 

A prince from an unknown country, Pierre is first seen working as a mascot for an amusement park that he owns. Excitable  to a fault and a bit clueless on Japanese customs. Carries a small frog toy (named [[Kaerre]]) of the amusement park's mascot around with him everywhere.
other_names: ピエール(アイドルマスター)
ピエール・ビシェルバーガー

title: mai_(senran_kagura)
body:
A playable character from the [[Senran Kagura]] videogame series. She makes her debut in [[Senran Kagura New Wave]].

A member of the idol group Milky Pop and a 2nd-year high school student. She often acts without considering the consequences, she was unexpectedly scouted and became an idol. She's pleased with her current situation in which many people love her, however, to continue being a ninja student, her true identity is kept a secret. Being both a ninja and an idol, she is carrying out a very reckless dream. Wielding a microphone stand model training sword, she carries out slashing attacks.

title: bai_winchester
body:
[[Closers]] character.

Closer of Wildhüter who uses the Blade of the Ice, which has the power of Dimensionals imbued into it. After a certain incident, Bai joins UNION with conviction to save who is important to her, fighting Dimensionals in her way. Creating alluring forms of ice together with the sword skills of her clan of assassins, she will now work not as an assassin, but as Closer who protects the people.

title: hakase_satomi
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 24 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Robotics Club and Jet Propulsion Club. She is the creator of [[karakuri chachamaru|Chachamaru]], and always working to upgrade her. She is very intelligent and quite obsessive when it comes to her work.

She is very close to [[Chao Lingshen]].

She wears [[glasses]] and has [[grey eyes]] with [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] worn in low [[twin braids]] with [[antenna hair]]. She has a large [[forehead]].

title: zazie_rainyday
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 31 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Acrobatics Club and Magic Club, and is the silent and mysterious girl of 2/3 A. She rarely associates with her fellow classmates; though she takes company in odd black spirits that appear around Mahora Academy.

She is often seen passing the time by juggling.

She has [[dark skin]], [[red eyes]], and [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with long [[sidelocks]]. She has two [[facial mark]]s: a [[teardrop facial mark|teardrop]] under her left eye, and a vertical line on the right side of her face.

title: hasegawa_chisame
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 25 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is perceived as a very reserved person, also very unsocial and very grumpy. She is not afraid to express her annoyance with others, particularly her classmates.

She has great computer skills; which she uses when she becomes the "[i]Legendary Net Idol, Chiu! (ちう!)[/i]":/post/show/2047, who is a happy, energetic [[cosplay]]ing girl. Besides her other self, Chisame surprisingly lacks confidence in her own looks.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] reddish [[brown hair]] kept in a [[low ponytail]]. She wears [[glasses]].

title: narutaki_fumika
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 23 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class; and the younger sister of the [[Narutaki Fuuka|Narutaki]] twins. She's almost the complete opposite in personality to her sister; though she will play pranks, because she is dragged along. She is also in the Strolling Club and Beautification Club.

She also enjoys playing Ninja and taking lessons from [[nagase kaede|Kaede]], but her ninjutsu is clearly low. And the lessons the girls are learning is not real ninjutsu.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] in [[double bun]]s.

title: narutaki_fuuka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 22 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class; and the older sister of the [[Narutaki Fumika|Narutaki]] twins. She's the mischievous one and likes to play pranks on other people. She is also in the Strolling Club.

She also enjoys playing Ninja and taking lessons from [[nagase kaede|Kaede]], but her ninjutsu is clearly low. And the lessons the girls are learning is not real ninjutsu.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] in [[twintails]].

title: naba_chizuru
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 21 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Astronomy Club and also volunteers at a Day Care, so she is a very motherly and kind person. Though she has been described as "strange".

She has [[brown eyes]] (with a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]]) and [[long hair|long]] [[red hair|reddish]] [[brown hair]] with two long [[sidelocks]] in spirals.

title: yukihiro_ayaka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 29 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is the wealthy class representative for Class 2/3 A, who keeps the class in order. She is also skilled in the martial arts.

She has an odd rivalry and friendship with [[kagurazaka asuna|Asuna]], and cares deeply for [[negi springfield|Negi]]; which her classmates see as unhealthy and 'obsessive'.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with long [[sidelocks]].

title: saotome_haruna
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 14 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Library Exploration Club and Manga Club. She is the creator of an original manga: "Mahou Shoujo Bibulion" or Biblion; going by the pen name Paru (Pal).

If there is a rumor going around, it is likely Haruna that started it, since she can be quite mischievous.

She has [[brown eyes]], [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[antenna hair]], and wears [[glasses]].

title: shiina_sakurako
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 17 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a Mahora Cheerleader and in the squad with [[kugimiya madoka|Madoka]] and [[kakizaki misa|Misa]]. She is very outgoing, positive and hyper. She is described as having great luck, so she has no problems gambling.

She enjoys [[karaoke]] and shopping with her friends.

She has [[brown eyes]] and  [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[orange hair]] worn in [[twintails]], with [[twin braids]] in back.

title: kugimiya_madoka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 11 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a Mahora Cheerleader and in the squad with [[shiina sakurako|Sakurako]] and [[kakizaki misa|Misa]].

Seems to be the most serious out of the three but knows when to have fun, she sticks up for her friends despite their antics. She has a complex about her husky voice. And she likes Silver accessories and Western Music.

She has [[black eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]].

title: yotsuba_satsuki
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 30 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Cooking Club and is the Lunch Rep. She works at the Chao Bao Zi Chinese restaurant cart with [[KuFei]] and [[Chao Lingshen]], along with [[Hakase Satomi]] and [[karakuri chachamaru|Chachamaru]]. One of her life goals is to be a Chef and have her own restaurant.

She is greatly admired by Mahora, and has [[evangeline a.k. mcdowell|Eva's]] highest respects. She likes to make people happy with her food.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] in [[short twintails]]. She is noticeably the most [[plump]] student in the class.

title: murakami_natsumi_(negima)
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 28 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. Although she is shy, she is in the Theatrical Club as an actress. She is self conscious about her appearance (considers herself underdeveloped), and is jealous of others' appearances.

Although forced into the role of older sister to [[Inugami Kotarou]], she gradually takes to it, and is quite protective of him.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] with [[freckles]] on her cheeks.

title: sasaki_makie
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 16 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in [[Rhythmic Gymnastics]] and has great skills with the gymnastics ribbon. She is quoted as being "Child like" and lacking mental strength, making her the second when it comes to low scores.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] worn in high [[short twintails]].

She is "Baka Pink" in the [[mahora_baka_rangers|Baka Rangers]] study group.

title: konoe_konoka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 13 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is Granddaughter to the Dean of Mahora Academy. Coming from a family line of Mage's, she has tremendous magical potential. Fortune telling and the supernatural being some her favorite things.

She is close friends with [[kagurazaka asuna|Asuna]], and also with her childhood protector [[Sakurazaki Setsuna]]. Konoka's personality can be described as very cheerful and optimistic.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[brown eyes]].

title: sakurazaki_setsuna
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 15 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a "hanyou" (half demon, half human) being. She is a [[kendo]] expert of the shinmei-ryu of fighting and has some knowledge of onmyoujutsu. She wields a [[ootachi]].

Loyal guardian and friend to [[Konoe Konoka]]. She gradually became close to her classmates.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[black hair]] up in a [[side ponytail]]. Due to her mixed heritage, she has a form of [[albino|albinism]], and a pair of white [[feathered wings]].

title: inugami_kotarou
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

He is a "hanyou" (half demon, half human) being. He is a good friend an rival to [[Negi Springfield]].

He lives with [[Naba Chizuru]], [[Murakami Natsumi (negima)|]], and [[Yukihiro Ayaka]]. His obvious and notable features are his [[dog ears]] and [[dog tail]].

title: ayase_yue
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 4 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a member of the Library Exploration Group. She is often seen drinking unusual beverages from juice boxes, unfortunately this leads to restroom trips. 

Despite her love of reading she actually gets low grades, due to dislike of studying. She is close friends with [[Miyazaki Nodoka]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair|purple]] [[twintails]] and [[purple eyes]].

She is "Baka Black" in the [[mahora_baka_rangers|Baka Rangers]] study group.

title: izumi_ako
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 5 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She works in the Nurses Office as an assistant. Despite this and her helpful nature, she is terrified of blood and very shy.

She develops a crush on a character named Nagi (which is really Negi), but thinks Nagi is Negi's cousin.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[light blue hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She has a large [[scar]] on her back, which she is very self-conscious about.

title: kakizaki_misa
body:
Character From [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 7 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a Mahora Cheerleader and she's in the Chorus Club. It is said that she is the only girl in class to have a steady boyfriend.

She likes karaoke and shopping with her friends, [[shiina_sakurako|Sakurako]] and [[kugimiya madoka|Madoka]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]].

title: kagurazaka_asuna
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 8 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is an orphan with a determined personality. It is well known that she has a crush on her teacher [[takahata_t_takamichi|Takahata]].

She can be quite stubborn and give into violent outbursts, but also has a fierce protective nature. This greatly shows when she's with [[Yukihiro Ayaka|Ayaka]] and Negi. For her [[Pactio]], she can summon either a [[harisen]] or [[ensis exorcizans|her huge sword]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[orange hair|orange]] [[twintails]] and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] eyes; her left is dark blue and her right is light green.

She is "Baka Red" in the [[Mahora Baka Rangers|Baka Rangers]] study group.

title: kasuga_misora
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 9 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Track and Field Club, and is revealed to be a Mage-in-training. She always wears a [[crucifix]] and is sometimes seen wearing a [[nun]] habit.

She appears reluctant to get involved in confrontations and is self-conscious about her magic ability: a pair of sneakers that give her speed and agility, the Joculatrix Monachans.

She has [[very short hair|very short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]].

title: cahciua
body:
Character in  in [i][[Final Fantasy XIV]][/i]: [i]Dawntrail[/i].

[[Erenville]]'s mother and mentor. She calls him her 'fussy little bun-bun' due to his sullen nature as a child. It was this nature that prompted her to push him to be a gleaner, hoping that seeing the world and meeting new people would improve his disposition.

At the time of [i]Dawntrail[/i], she has become the leader of the covert organization Oblivion, leading it remotely via an [[outrunner_(ffxiv)|Outrunner]] drone.

[spoilers]It is later revealed that she had died during the 30-year timeskip following Alexandria's incursion. The Outrunner was being controlled by a simulacrum built from her stored memories, one of many Endless caught in limbo in Living Memory. Her ultimate goal was to be released along with the other Endless, allowing all of them to finally pass on.[/spoilers]

title: karakuri_chachamaru
body:
A character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]]. An [[android]] girl.

Seat 10 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a robot created by [[Hakase Satomi]] (and possibly [[Chao Lingshen]]) to serve [[evangeline a.k. mcdowell|Evangeline]] and protect her. She is in the [[Go (board game)|]] Club and the Tea Ceremony Club. She is very skilled in hand combat and weaponry.

Chachamaru functions by a combination of technology and magic.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]].

title: asakura_kazumi
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 3 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is the resident class Reporter and works for the Mahora newspaper, she will go to great lengths to get a huge scoop.

It is rare to see Kazumi without a camera. She becomes friends with the class ghost - [[Aisaka Sayo]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] bright [[red hair]] in a bushy [[ponytail]].

title: miyazaki_nodoka
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 27 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She helps at the Mahora Library and bookstore, and is a part of the Reader's Club and Library Exploration Club. She is very passive and shy; one of her best friends is [[Ayase Yue]].

She develops a crush on [[Negi Springfield|Negi]], and is the second (after [[kagurazaka asuna|Asuna]]) to have a provisionary contract with him.

She has chin length [[blue hair]] and she later ties her hair in a [[ponytail]].

title: akashi_yuuna
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 2 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is in the Sports Club and plays [[basketball]].

She is shown to have a great love for her father, Professor Akashi. And has a great dislike of any woman who appears to be getting close to him.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] in a [[side ponytail]].

title: aisaka_sayo
body:
Character from [[Mahou Sensei Negima!]].

Seat 1 in [[Negi Springfield]]'s class. She is a shy ghost who died 60 years before the series started. For some time she was unable to be seen or interact with anyone.

As a ghost she has white hair, red eyes, and a pale appearance. She wears a traditional sailor style [[school uniform]].

She befriends classmate [[Asakura Kazumi]].

title: erenville
body:
Character in  in [i][[Final Fantasy XIV]][/i]. Introduced briefly in [i]Endwalker[/i], before playing a more major role in [i]Dawntrail[/i].

A gleaner for Sharlyan, specializing in the procurement of animal specimens. Originally from a small village in Tural, where he was raised (and trained) by his mother [[Cahciua]]. A friend of [[Wuk Lamat]] since childhood, he grudgingly agrees to accompany her on the Rite of Succession.

title: continental_magic_association_receptionist_(sousou_no_frieren)
body:
A minor female character in [[Sousou no Frieren]]. She acts as the receptionist for the northern branch of the Continental Magic Association in Äußerst. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] in a [[bob cut]] and [[blue eyes]] and typically wears [[glasses]] and a [[beret]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #20651826

h4. External links

title: zi-apollo_(code_geass)
body:
[b]UZZ-001s Zi-Apollo[/b]

A [[Knightmare frame]] from [[Code Geass: Dakkan no Roze]] operated by the Nameless Mercenaries. A High maneuverable KMF developed for close combat equipped with six 'Slash Harkens', two [[arm blade]]s and the Blaze Luminous ([[energy shield]]) system. Painted primarily in dark blue, red and silver, piloted by [[Ash Phoenix]]. The real life mechanical designer of Zi-Apollo is Junichi Akutsu (BEE-CRAFT).

Zi-Apollo can enter a boosted performance mode by lowering an [[assault visor]], it can also combine with the [[Zi-Artemis (code geass)|]] and form the [[Zi-Ortygia (code geass)|]] unit.

title: sumeragi_sakuya
body:
The protagonist of [[Code Geass]] [[code_geass:_dakkan_no_roze|Dakkan no Roze]] under the fake identity of [[Roze (code geass)|]]. Voiced by [[Ueda Reina]].

An heir to both the Britannian Imperial family as well as the Sumeragi family of Kyoto house, her [[Geass]] is the power of absolute obedience, given through vocal commands.

When she is out of her disguise, Sakuya has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] in a [[hime cut]] style, her eyes are [[pink eyes|pink]], wears a [[metal collar]] that suppresses her Geass as well as changes her voice when disguised as Roze.

h4. See also
* [[Roze (code geass)|]] <tn>Disguise persona</tn>
* [[Ash Phoenix]]
* [[Haruyanagininomiya Sakura]] <tn>Identical looking body double</tn>

body: [b]Ryomen Sukuna[/b] is a mighty cursed spirit known as the undisputed [b]King of Curses[/b]. He serves as one of the primary antagonists of the [[Jujutsu Kaisen]] series. In the present, Sukuna has been incarnated into [[Itadori Yuuji]] due to the latter eating one of his cursed fingers, which contain his fragmented power.

title: prussia_(hetalia)
body:
"Human" name: [b]Gilbert Beilschmidt[/b]

Sometimes substituted for fans as [i][[Axis Powers Hetalia]][/i]'s [[personification|representation]] of East Germany, for the German Democratic Republic had territories contiguous to old Prussia. Subtly hinted as such in some strips showing him forced to work with [[russia_(hetalia)|Russia]] after World War II.

A man with a big ego, Prussia has [[silver_hair|light beige-blond hair]], [[red eyes]] and wears a dark blue [[military uniform]].

title: heathcliff_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.07 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based on the main character of the 19th century novel "Wuthering Heights":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wuthering_Heights written by English novelist "Emily Brontë":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emily_Brontë.

He has [[short hair|short]], [[messy hair|messy]], [[brown hair|brown hair]], [[dark skin]], [[purple eyes]], [[scar|scars]] across his entire body, and wears a [[ring]] across most of his identities. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black pants]], but replaces the [[black vest]] and [[black coat]] with a [[shoulder holster]]. 

He wields a metallic [[baseball bat]] with the English word 'REVENGE' etched into the side in his base identity. [spoiler]After Canto VI, the word etched into the bat is changed to 'REmember'.[/spoiler] 

h4. Official art
* !post #5026237

h4. See also
* [spoiler][[Erlking Heathcliff (project moon)|]][/spoiler]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]

title: ai_ai_gasa
body:
A drawing consisting of two lovers' names beneath a sketch of an [[umbrella]]. It is the Japanese equivalent of writing the lovers' names inside a heart as done in the West.

For two people sharing an actual umbrella, use the tag [[shared umbrella]].

By the way, it's not written "愛愛傘" with "ai", the kanji for "love", but is variously written "相合傘", "相合い傘", "相々傘", and "相相傘". So the translation isn't really "love love umbrella" but more like "togetherness umbrella".

h4. Examples

* !post #1009561
* !post #6948177

h4. See also

* [[shared umbrella]]

title: tsunokakushi
body:
A headwear worn in traditional Japanese [[wedding]] ceremonies, consisting of a piece of cloth wrapped around the [[bride]]'s hair. This generally allows the hair to peek through, and the look often includes other hair adornments.

For the more [[hood]]like design, see [[wataboushi]].

* !post #3151251

* [[uchikake]]
* [[wataboushi]]

title: wataboushi
body:
A [[hood]] or [[veil]]-like form of headgear worn by [[bride]]s in traditional Japanese [[wedding]] ceremonies. Unlike the [[tsunokakushi]] (another form of traditional wedding headgear), the wataboushi more fully covers the bride's hair.

h4. Examples

* !post #5136672
* !post #3262203

* [[uchikake]]

body:
[i]"Incredible...from such a height..."[/i]

[[Pouring]] liquid from a great height or in an improbable manner. May be impressive, but often ends in [[failure]].

Named for a [[meme]] born from a humorous typo in an English scanlation of [[Kami no Shizuku]]. The proper word is "decanting".

h4. Examples

* !post #6736624
* !post #133108: Origin

h4.See also

title: disposable_coffee_cup
body:
A [[disposable cup]] designed for holding [[coffee]]. They're usually made of paper, with a snap-on lid and an insulating cardboard sleeve.

Not to be confused with a [[coffee mug]], which is not disposable; nor with [[teacup]], which is smaller and usually paired with a [[saucer]].

The iconic [[Starbucks]] logo may be present on these cups.

title: shining_(arknights)
body:
[i]Shining, Sarkaz healer, will do everything she can to provide medical care for the squad[/i]

A playable Medic Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Qui'saršinnag[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 7[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]175 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]7 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former member of the Sarkaz group, "The Confessors" and current member of the infected assistance group, "The Followers". She is an authority in fields such as Originium Arts, field medicine, medical theories, and clinical medicine. She is now a Medic Operator at Rhodes Island, contributing her knowledge on Originium Arts theories and providing medical support for many an operation.

Although her race is a Sarkaz, which normally represent demons, her motif and appearance is based on traditional Elves.

Her [[voice actor]] is Risa Shimizu.

h4. Skins
* !post #3563817: Base
* !post #3563820: Elite ii
* !post #3697411: [[Shining (Silent Night) (Arknights)|Silent Night]]
* !post #4477410: [[shining_(ambience_synesthesia)_(arknights)| Ambience Synesthesia]]
other_names: シャイニング(アークナイツ)

title: palmar_flexion
body:
When the wrist hangs forward loosely. The opposite of [[dorsiflexion_(wrist)| dorsiflexion of the wrist]].

H4. Potential usage
• [[Embarrassed]] or flattered; an "Oh stop it you!" gesture.
• [[Disgust]].
• Shaking off [[wet]] hands.
• A [[beckoning]] / "Come here" gesture.
• (Japan) when waving the hand horizontally in front of the face - “I can’t help you”, “It wasn’t me”, or “I don’t want it”.
• Wafting a scent either closer or farther away.
• [[Fanning self]] with own hand.
• Showing off a [[ring]] or [[nail polish]].
• "Enchanté"; presenting hand for a kiss.
• [[Checking watch]] gesture.
• 'Dinosaur hands' / 'raptor hands', [[zombie pose]], [[ghost pose]], [[rabbit pose]].
• [[Shooing]] gesture; go away gesture.
• Effeminate gestures: [[girly running]], [[girly boy]]s, etc.
• [[Marionette]] movements; puppet movements.

title: leon_the_professional
body: A 1994 French action thriller movie titled [I]The Professional[/I] in the United States and [I]Leon[/I] in the United Kingdom and Australia. It stars [[Jean Reno]] in the title role as [[Leon (Leon The Professional)|Leon]] and features [[Natalie Portman]] making her film debut at the age of just 12 as [[Mathilda Lando]]. It became a surprise hit in Japan and China due to similar themes as many classic Kung-fu movies and a very popular soundtrack CD.

title: schwarz_(arknights)
body:
[i]Schwarz, Operator of Rhodes Island, will protect you from the shadows[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Rim Billiton[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]Individual exhibits memory loss regarding this information.[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Feline[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]169 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]20 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A guardian of Doycos family and former Bureau Chief of Siesta Urban Public Security Bureau, she joined Rhodes Island at the same time as Ceylon after the Obsidian Festival incident. She has outstanding achievements in covert operations, reconnaissance and anti-reconnaissance, survival, and crossbow usage. She is in charge of protecting the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]] and is responsible for the training of basic level Rhodes Island's operators.

Together with [[Ceylon_(Arknights)|Ceylon]], she is the supporting characters in the side story [i]Heart of Surging Flames ~ Obsidian Festival[/i].

Her motif is based on black panthers.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Itou_Shizuka|Shizuka Ito]].

title: alhaitham_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]].

He is a member of the Sumeru Akademiya's Haravatat who is known as the "Scribe", and is loosely based on [[Su (Honkai Impact)|]] from [[Honkai Impact 3rd]].

His localized name has a spelling mistake, where it should be written as either Al Haitham or Al-Haitham, with "Al" being translated as "The", which is comparable to writing [[Signora (genshin impact)|La Signora]] as "Lasignora" or [[Statue of The Seven]] as "Statue of Theseven".

title: meica_(vtuber)
body:
Argentinian [[Virtual YouTuber]] with a nature theme. Debuted as an [[indie virtual youtuber|independent]], joined [[Idol Corp]] as part of their first Spanish-speaking generation in May 2024, and later graduated after Idol's acquisition by Brave Group in November 2024. She was designed by [[PMasterM]] (early indie) and [[Kisaragi Yuri]].

She has [[heterochromia|heterochromic eyes]] and [[mismatched pupils]], her right eye being [[green eyes|green]] featuring a [[sprout-shaped pupils|sprout-shaped pupil]], while her left eye is [[brown eyes|brown]] with a [[cross-shaped pupils|cross-shaped pupil]]. Her hair is [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], primarily [[brown hair|brown]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[colored inner hair|inner hair]]. It is of [[medium hair|medium length]] and is styled with [[hair flaps]], a [[single braid]], and an [[ahoge]].

h4. Costumes

title: diesel_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of Infinity Rail.

She is the leader of Infinity Rail who took [[Brid (nikke)|]]'s place and has a fondness for strawberry candies. She operates the AZX, the Ark's high-speed train.

She has [[brown eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[bangs]] & [[sidelocks]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] consisting of a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[military hat|military]] [[peaked cap]], [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[military jacket|military]] [[jacket on shoulders]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[blue necktie|blue]] [[striped necktie]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]], [[black belt]], [[thigh belt]], [[thigh pouch]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. Usually depicted [[holding gun|holding]] an [[rpk]] [[light machine gun]].

In her past life as a human, Diesel was a member of the AFX, a locomotive that is likely the predecessor to the AZX, alongside the people who would later be known as Brid and [[Soline (nikke)|]] respectively. However, a terrorist bombing instigated by [[Crow (nikke)|]] occurs, killing Diesel alongside her little brother and the other passengers of AFX. All the female passengers killed eventually became Nikkes who worked in the railways.

h4. Official art
* !post #5907391: Default
* !post #5953763: [[Diesel (Black Sunday) (Nikke)|Black Sunday]]
* !post #7531050: [[Diesel (Midnight Strawberry) (Nikke)|Midnight Strawberry]]
* !post #6739876: [[Diesel (Strawberry Flower) (Nikke)|Strawberry Flower]]
other_names: ディーゼル(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: dream_smp
body:
The Dream SMP was a private, whitelisted survival multiplayer [[Minecraft YouTube|Minecraft]] server played on by the Dream Team and their friends. It is famous for being a roleplay themed server with a mostly improvisational plot and a long history of alliances, wars, factions, eras, and characters. Livestreams, VODs, and server highlights can be found on Twitch and YouTube.

For a list of characters, see [[List of Minecraft YouTubers]].

h4. See also
* [[Tales from the SMP]] - Spinoff series
* [[Passerine (dream smp)|]] - Popular fanfiction universe

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Dream SMP":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dream_SMP
* "Dream SMP Wiki: Dream SMP":https://dreamteam.fandom.com/wiki/Dream_SMP

title: desert
body:
An arid, barren environment. Usually covered in predominantly [[sand]] or very loose soil with few animals and plants (e.g. [[palm tree]]s and [[cactus|cacti]]) which can survive with very small amounts of water.

Commonly featured in Middle Eastern setting or [[post-apocalypse]] fiction to show that resources are scarce or some event has killed most of the life on Earth.

[b]Not to be confused[/b] with sweet food items consumed at the end of a meal, known as a [[dessert]].

h1. See also
* [[bare tree]], [[bare bush]]
* [[beach]]
* [[desert camouflage]]
* [[mesa]]
* [[oasis]]

title: blueprint_(object)
body:
A schematics of an object, either a [[building]], [[vehicle]], or [[weapon]], used as a reference in designing the object and building the said design. Typically comes in blue sheet of paper for contrast purposes, though not all blueprint were blue nor a sheet of paper.

This tag is for the depiction of a blueprint(s) as a prop. For posts that stylized itself as a blueprint, see [[blueprint (medium)]].

title: ginga_hyouryuu_vifam
body:
[b][i]Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam[/i][/b] (銀河漂流バイファム, [i]"Galactic Drifter Vifam"[/i]) is the name of a [[mecha]] anime television series (and its eponymous robot, the [[Vifam]]) created by Sunrise in the early [[1980s_(style)|80s]].

Vifam premiered in Japan on Japan News Network's TV stations (including MBS and [[TBS]]) between October 21, 1983 and September 8, 1984. It was directed by Kanda Takeyuki and included mechanical designs by legendary artist [[Ookawara Kunio]] and character designs by the late [[Ashida Toyoo]].

Set in the far future, the plot of the show narrates the adventures of a group of children and teenagers who try to flee the invasion of their colony planet by hostile aliens while escaping aboard [[janus_(ginga_hyouryuu_vifam)|a giant spaceship equipped with several mecha]].

"The show's intro theme":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qwszwb3aIPg ("Hello Vifam") was composed and performed by the Japanese progressive rock band [b]TAO[/b]. This theme is one of the first Japanese animation title songs written entirely with [[english_text|English]] language lyrics.

A sequel television anime, [i][b]Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam 13[/b][/i] (銀河漂流バイファム13), aired on MBS and its affiliated networks between March 21, 1998 and October 3, 1998. The first series was also later re-run in Japan on Animax in December 23, 2006.

Use this tag if the character's age is shown. This is usually found in a [[character profile]] or [[reference sheet]] and shown next to "Age" or in parentheses next to the character's name.

Watch for these written characters near a number when looking at profiles in different languages:
* Japanese: 才 or 歳 or 年齢

title: jill_ratokie
body:
A fictional [[child|underage]] character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He appears in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV anime series from 1979.

[b]Jill Ratokie[/b] is the brother of [[Miharu Ratokie]] and [[Milly Ratokie]]. [spoilers]Some years after Miharu's death and the end of [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]] he joins the [[titans_(gundam)|Titan]]'s Cyber-Newtype Murasame program (along with [[Four Murasame]]) but is killed as his body is unable to cope with the tremendous mental energy overload of the Psycommu system onboard the [[Psyco Gundam]].[/spoilers]

title: container

For intermodal freight containers, see [[shipping container]].

title: octane_(apex_legends)
body:
Playable legend in [[Apex Legends]], added in Season 1. A daredevil with [[mechanical legs]] who utilizes stims for faster movement.

Octane's default outfit consists of a [[green vest|green]] [[cropped vest]] that exposes his [[abs]], a pair of [[grey shorts]], and a pair of [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]]. His face is obscured by the combination of a [[mouth mask]], [[goggles]], and a piece of [[black headwear]], though official art later revealed his appearance. Underneath the mask he has [[brown eyes]], a [[stubble]] [[beard]], and [[undercut]] [[brown hair]] with [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], though anime-styled fanart will often instead portray him with solid green hair and [[green eyes]] under the mask.

He often makes a [[\m/]] gesture and has an [[arm tattoo]] that reads "PLUS ULTRA" on his left arm. His heirloom weapon is the [[Butterfly Knife (apex legends)|]]. Octane grew up on [[Olympus (apex legends)|]] and is a childhood friend of [[Lifeline (apex legends)|]], as well as the son of syndicate leader and crime boss [[Eduardo Silva]]. Often pictured holding large [[syringe]]s used to inject stim fluid for his tactical ability. Images featuring Octane may feature [[Spanish text]], as overseas dubs retain Spanish words and phrases as part of his voice lines.

body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

An [[Earth Federation]] development of the [[Asshimar]] variable [[mobile suit]] from the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]], this transformable MS is heavily armed and impressively fast despite its massive size.

title: balancing_egg
body:
This tag refers to the act of [[balancing]] an [[egg]].  This is may refer to a tradition where this is done in China on [[Chinese New Year]], when a myth states that this can only be done on this date.  The tradition has been adopted by western nations, adapting the myth to say that they can only be balanced on the vernal equinox or at the equator. In reality it can be done at any place or time of year but is difficult due to eggs' natural shape and composition.

* !post #4339928

* "Wikipedia - Egg Balancing":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egg_balancing]

title: finch
body:
"Finch" is an imprecise term for type of small perching [[bird]]. "True finches" are small to medium-sized birds in the family Fringillidae, containing more than 200 species. It includes species known as siskins, canaries, redpolls, serins, grosbeaks and euphonias.

Finches have stout conical bills adapted for eating seeds and often have colorful plumage. They occupy a great range of habitats where they are usually resident and do not migrate.

Many birds in other families are also commonly called "finches". These groups include: the estrildid finches (Estrildidae) of the Old World tropics and Australia; some members of the Old World bunting family and the American sparrow family; and the Darwin's finches of the Galapagos islands, now considered members of the tanager family.

h4. See also
* [[American Goldfinch]]
* [[Double-barred Finch]]
* [[Eurasian Bullfinch]]
* [[Gouldian Finch]]
* [[Japanese Grosbeak]]
* [[Java Sparrow]]
* [[Zebra Finch]]
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

title: robbie_the_rabbit
body: Robbie the Rabbit is an anthropomorphic rabbit doll that has made appearances in many of the [[Silent Hill (series)|]]  games. In some of his appearances, his mouth is covered with blood. For the most part his appearance seems to serve little more than to provide an ambiguous level of unease to the player, due to the odd nature of his existence within the world of Silent Hill, his bright colours compared to the rust brown and dark red of everything else, and his recurring cameos.

title: yuru-chara
body:
Japanese term for a category of [[mascot]] characters; usually created to promote a place or region, event, organisation or business. They are characterized by their kawaii (cute) and unsophisticated designs, often incorporating motifs that represent local culture, history or produce. They may be created by local government or other organizations to stimulate tourism and economic development, or created by a company to build on their corporate identity. They may appear as costumed characters (or [[kigurumi]]) at promotional events and festivals. Yuru-chara has become a popular and lucrative business, with character-driven sales reaching nearly $16 billion in Japan in 2012.

Popular yuru-chara include [[Kumamon]], [[Funasshii]], and [[Chiitan]], who have gained international recognition and have reached celebrity status in Japan.

h4. External links

* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuru-chara

body:
A small stick-like object used to determine whether or not a woman is [[pregnant]], determined by matching (usually) pink lines after a urine sample.

In what tends to be uploaded to Danbooru, they're meant as a joke about [[cum in pussy|unprotected sex]] and/or pregnancies unwanted by at least one of the involved parties.

A minor [[meme]] related to pregnancy tests cropped up in late 2014, where a feminine finger pointing to a pregnancy test would be added into existing images. (See post #1824996 and its parent.)

Do not add the [[pregnant]] tag unless the character has a visibly pregnant belly.

body:
[b]Cell[/b] is one of the main villains of the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise. He was first introduced in [[Dragon Ball Z]] as the main antagonist of the Android/Cell Saga.

An [[android]] created by [[Dr. Gero (dragon ball)|]] from the DNA samples of [[Son Goku|Goku]], [[Vegeta]], [[Frieza]], and [[Piccolo]]. First appearing in his [[Imperfect Cell|Imperfect form]], he set about absorbing [[Android 17|Androids 17]] and [[Android 18|18]], first absorbing the former to achieve his [[Semi-Perfect Cell|Semi-Perfect form]], and then the latter for his [[perfect cell|Perfect form]]. Afterward, he establishes the Cell Games and challenges everyone on Earth to defeat him.

title: frieza
body:
[b]Frieza[/b] is one of the main antagonist of the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise, first introduced in [[Dragon Ball Z]] as the titular main antagonist of the Frieza Saga. 

The Emperor of Universe 7, he was responsible for the genocide of the Saiyans. His goal in the original appearance is to find the Namekian [[Dragon Ball (object)|]]s to grant him the wish for immortality. He first appears in his [[1st form frieza|1st form]], before going through each ([[2nd form frieza|2nd form]] and [[3rd form frieza|3rd]]), before revealing his [[final form frieza|final form]] (which he can charge up to [[full power frieza|full power]]). His last appearance in the original manga would see him [[mecha frieza|mechanically enhanced]].

Best known for his cold, arrogant, and egotistical altitude, along with his sadistic tendencies towards his enemies or anyone belonging to the race he deemed inferior, both verbally and physically. This later became an archtypical trait of several all-powerful and self-centered villains in various manga and anime. He also has a rivalry with his non-canonical older brother, [[Cooler (dragon ball)|]].

His [[Frieza clan|clan]] is known for having multiple forms and named after cold objects. He returns in [[Dragon Ball Super]] with new forms, [[Golden Frieza]] and [[Black Frieza]], themed after credit card levels, the first featuring prominently across Frieza's appearances in Super.

He has several subordinates, prominently including:

* [[Zarbon]]
* [[Dodoria]]
* [[Ginyu Force|The Ginyu Force]]
** [[Captain Ginyu]]
** [[Jeice]]
** [[Burter]]
** [[Recoome]]
** [[Guldo]]
* [[Saiyan|Saiyans]]
** [[Vegeta]]
** [[Nappa]]
** [[Raditz]]

h4. See also

title: jikan_sokougun
body:
The enemies of [[Touken Ranbu]], which come from the future to change history in their favor. Like their [[Kantai Collection]] counterparts the [[abyssal ship]], they are notably monstrous in looks. Weaker enemies resemble skeletons, while tougher enemies appear human. Others are somewhere in between these two states in a [[centauroid]] fashion, with the humanlike upper half attached to a skeleton creature.

Frequently characterized by their [[pale skin]], undead appearance, and deathly [[aura]] (often green, but can be red or purple). Their character design is done by [[Ishitsu Kenzou]], artist of [[Tonbokiri_(touken_ranbu)|]].

Although there are not direct analogues to the Touken Danshi, fanart tends to create [[dark persona|corrupted versions]] of them similar to the Revisionists.

Also known as the [i]Retrograde Forces[/i] or [i]Historical Revisionists[/i].

h4. List of Enemies

title: kaga_(battleship)
body:
The Japanese aircraft carrier [[Kaga (aircraft carrier)|]] portrayed as a [[battleship]] instead.

[i]Kaga[/i] was originally planned and constructed as a [i]Tosa[/i]-class battleship, before that class of ships was rendered superfluous (while still under construction) by the 1922 Washington Naval Treaty. [i]Tosa[/i], the lead ship of the class, was expended as an armor test target, but [i]Kaga[/i] was spared that fate by the destruction of the battlecruiser-turned-carrier [i]Amagi[/i] in the 1923 Great Kanto Earthquake, which led to her hull being converted into a carrier instead.

h4. See also

* [[Kaga (Battleship) (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Kaga (Battleship) (Kancolle)]]

title: gitano_(arknights)
body:
[i]Gitano, Caster Operator of Rhodes Island, will draw plans for the squad with her Originium Arts.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Ragna

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Sami[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 15[/td][/tr]

      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]

A mystic from Sami, tarot expert and a great card player. She has never spoken to anyone of her past prior coming to Rhodes Island, and it remains a mystery. All anyone knows is that her readings are very accurate. Divination is a hobby to her that she does almost for free, accepting fruits and cakes as a token payment. Also knows countless other card tricks, and unless she's caught red-handed, she'll never admit to cheating.

Her motif is based on [[reindeer]]s. Her callsign is Spanish for [i]gypsy[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is Kana Yuuki.

title: carole_&_tuesday
body:
Fifty years have passed since mankind began migrating to the new frontier: Mars. It's an age where most culture is produced by AI, and people are content to be passive consumers.

There's a girl. Scrapping a living in the metropolis of Alba City, she's working part time while trying to become a musician. She's always felt like something is missing. Her name is Carole.

There's a girl. Born to a wealthy family in the provincial town of Herschel City, she dreams of becoming a musician, but nobody around her understands. She feels like the loneliest person in the world. Her name is Tuesday.

A chance meeting brings them together. They want to sing. They want to make music. Together, they feel like they just might have a chance. The two of them may only create a tiny wave. But that wave will eventually grow into something larger...
other_names: キャロル&チューズデイ
キャロル_チューズデイ
