title: maou_evelogia_ni_mi_wo_sasage_yo
body: Known in English as Everything for Demon King Evelogia. An web anime (ONA) under the category [[yaoi|Boys Love]], Fantasy, Erotica and Isekai. It premiered between Oct 2, 2021 to Nov 27, 2021. Its runtime is 6 minutes, with 9 episodes total. Ever since he laid hands on his favorite game, [[Toshiaki Gozu]] has admired its loathsome main villain: the demon king [[Evelogia]], detested by all yet a character accompanied by loneliness his entire life. [br] With his past crimes having caught up to him, Toshiaki is held hostage at gunpoint by a yakuza and is ultimately killed. Following his untimely end, he finds himself in a surprisingly familiar room—a setting of the game where Evelogia exists. Although the revelation delights him, disappointment creeps in as Toshiaki realizes that he is the character who is destined to assassinate the great demon king. [br] However, Toshiaki rejects his role and instead allies himself with Evelogia. Now with someone trustworthy by his side for the first time ever, Evelogia is emotional. But living regular lives proves to be challenging for both of them; Evelogia wields uncontrollable destructive power while Toshiaki grows dangerously obsessed with the antagonist.

title: jungle_cat_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. She first appeared in the original 2015 mobile game, and later appeared in [[Kemono Friends 3]] with an updated character design. Contrary to the name, the jungle cat is not a species that inhabits jungles; nonetheless, Friends of Japari Park seem to think that Jungle Cat is a wild feline tempered by the perils of the jungle. Consequently, she feels she has to maintain that illusion— lest other Friends decide she is uninteresting— but she simultaneously resents this and wishes she could be honest.

In September 2022, a [[virtual YouTuber]] based on Jungle Cat debuted under the franchise's [[Kemono Friends V Project|KemoV Project]] label as a member of its second wave, debuting alongside [[Brown Long-Eared Bat (Kemono Friends)|Brown Long-Eared Bat]] and [[Siberian Chipmunk (Kemono Friends)|Siberian Chipmunk]]. Known for her gentle and mature voice, KemoV's Jungle Cat is a talented artist who often makes art for herself and other KemoV members, including emotes and channel assets, and is a skillful gamer who is an [[Apex Legends]] veteran. She sports a great knowledge of horse racing and cars.

h4. External links

* "Jungle Cat (KemoV)'s YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtJSUW-5FnwfaivXpluABWA
* "Jungle Cat (KemoV)'s Twitter":https://twitter.com/Junglecat_KEMOV
* "Jungle Cat (KemoV)'s Twitch":https://www.twitch.tv/junglecat__kemov

title: dorsiflexion_(wrist)
body:
Bending the wrist far backward, either by means of letting it fall backwards limply, or having it pressed up against something. The opposite of [[palmar flexion]]. 

h4. Usage examples
* "No thanks"; "I don’t want it" gesture.
* [[Rejection]]; "Go away" gesture.
* Indicating towards something. (Note that in Japan, [[pointing]] with one's finger may be considered rude, so using the whole hand is a polite/formal alternative).
* "Effeminate poses"; [[girly running]], [[girly boy]], etc.
* "Why?" gesture.
* "Rebellious", "bratty" body language; [[mesugaki]] and [[osugaki]].
* "Give it to me" gesture.
* [[Beckoning]]; "come here".
* "Hand shrug" / "I don't know" gesture; [[confused|confusion]].
* [[Stretching]] poses (e.g post #4390381).
* [[Shading eyes]].

title: siberian_chipmunk_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park. She first appeared in the original 2015 mobile game, and later appeared in [[Kemono Friends Pavilion]] and [[Kemono Friends 3]], in 2020 and 2022 respectively, with an updated character design. She is typically depicted as an energetic and driven character who enjoys foraging.

In September 2022, a [[virtual YouTuber]] based on Siberian Chipmunk debuted under the franchise's [[Kemono Friends V Project|KemoV Project]] label as a member of its second wave, debuting alongside [[Brown Long-Eared Bat (Kemono Friends)|Brown Long-Eared Bat]] and [[Jungle Cat (Kemono Friends)|Jungle Cat]]. In April 2024, Siberian Chipmunk graduated from the KemoV Project amicably and on her own terms, becoming the project's second graduate after [[African Penguin (Kemono Friends)|African Penguin's]] graduation two years prior. KemoV's Siberian Chipmunk was known for her confident and upbeat personality, her keen intellect, and her gaming prowess.

h4. External links

* "Siberian Chipmunk (KemoV)'s YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKob71cjOlyYF5bgvtGuNKQ
* "Siberian Chipmunk (KemoV)'s Twitter":https://twitter.com/Shimarisu_KEMOV

title: african_penguin_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character and one of the many "Friends" in Japari Park. African Penguin, also sometimes known as Cape Penguin, first appeared in [[Kemono Friends Pavilion]] and has since appeared in [[Kemono Friends 3]]. She looks up to [[Humboldt Penguin (Kemono Friends)|Humboldt Penguin]] and is sometimes shown to have a competitive but sisterly dynamic with her.

In April 2021, a [[virtual YouTuber]] based on African Penguin debuted under the franchise's [[Kemono Friends V Project|KemoV Project]] label as one of its founding members, alongside Humboldt Penguin; similarly to their in-game counterparts, these two posed as sisters. In May 2022, African Penguin graduated from the KemoV Project amicably and on her own terms, becoming the first graduated member of the project.

h4. External links

title: lyza_(made_in_abyss)
body:
Character From [[Made in Abyss]].

Lyza "[i]The Annihilator[/i]" is [[Riko_(made_in_abyss)|]]'s mother. Lyza is a legendary white whistle delver who accomplished many great discoveries about the secrets of the Abyss. She is known as the Lord of Annihilation for her tendency to exterminate all enemies she encountered within the Abyss, be it dangerous beasts or delvers from other countries.

In her canonical appearance, Lyza has a [[very long hair|very long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]] with curls at the ends that reaches her knees, large [[blue eyes]], and a light skin-tone. Her attire consists of a [[red jacket]] and a [[brown helmet|brown]] [[helmet]].

title: star_wars_manga
body:
A late 90s official manga adaptation of the original trilogy of [[Star Wars]] films by Japanese artists and released in both America and Japan by "Dark Horse comics":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_Horse_Comics in 1998. 

To conform to Western standards, for the English versions the art was copied in mirror-image in order to be read from left to right.

While the manga's artwork was entirely done by Japanese artists, the cover art for each volume of the manga was done in [[artist collaboration|collaboration]] by Westerner artists [[Joe Wight]] and [[Adam Warren]] in the manga series [[official style]] (mostly).

title: check_artist
body:
The artist(s) for a particular post has been identified, but a second opinion is needed for verification. Can be used when the post is retrieved from a source that is not owned by the artist in question (ie. [[third-party_source]], certain Twitter accounts, music albums, etc).

Do not use this tag if the source data already provides the artist's name. An exception to this is when the post in question consists of an [[artist collaboration]] between two or more artists.

title: 2024_niconico_cyberattack
body:
On June 8th, 2024, [[NicoNico]] experienced a cyber attack that caused the site to go down, leaving only a blog message from the management team for anyone attempting to use the site.

Users on social media made art to support the team as they worked to bring NicoNico back online with the hashtag "#がんばれニコニコ運営":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/%E3%81%8C%E3%82%93%E3%81%B0%E3%82%8C%E3%83%8B%E3%82%B3%E3%83%8B%E3%82%B3%E9%81%8B%E5%96%B6] (Do your best, NicoNico management).

On June 14th, NicoNico management gave an "update":[https://twitter.com/nico_nico_info/status/1801495272163525035] that it would take over a month for services to be restored.

At the end of July, NicoNico management announced that they would be reviving services on August 5th.

h4. See also
* pool #5960 (Current Events)

h4. External links

* "NicoNico Info (blog by management)":[https://blog.nicovideo.jp/niconews/225099.html]
* "June 14th update tweet":[https://twitter.com/nico_nico_info/status/1801495272163525035]
* "Update announcing revival of services on August 5th":[https://blog.nicovideo.jp/niconews/225330.html]
other_names: がんばれニコニコ運営
負けるなニコニコ運営
ニコニコ復活おめでとう

title: collaboration
body: For collaborations between multiple artists, use [[artist collaboration]]. For crossovers, use [[crossover]].

title: second-party_edit
body: Like [[third-party edit]], except the one doing the editing is a second-party to the work (such as its [[commission|commissioner]]) rather than a third-party.  If the commissioner is also an artist themselves, the distinction between this and [[artist collaboration]] may become blurry.

title: yamoge
body:
Doujin novelist / fanfic story creator / writer. Usually asks other artists to draw art for [[Artist collaboration|his doujin novels]]. 
He often uploads doujin [[cover_page|cover pages]] and samples to his Pixiv account with permission of the real artists.

Note that most images posted on their accounts [[second-party source|aren't drawn by him]], and the doujins are usually drawn by two (front cover, other illustrations and back cover) or more artists. The commentary, image or product page will give it away, as he will usually credit the artists by either mentioning their name or linking their Pixiv or Twitter accounts. Please try to be careful and tag the original artists of the images.

body:

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black shirt]] with a white vertical stripe to the front, an [[Iron Cross]] medal on a red [[sash]], [[headphones]], [[black hat|black]] [[baseball cap]] with another Iron Cross, [[black gloves]], [[black bikini]] with [[multi-strapped bikini|multiple straps]], black [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[black socks|sock]] on her right and [[black thighhighs|thighhigh]] on her left), and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is themed like an animalistic motorbike (with bike handles) and patterned off her real-life hull.

title: aoba_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Aoba[/i].

She is portrayed with [[messy_hair|messy]] [[pink hair]] or [[purple hair]] (depends on the artist) tied into a [[ponytail]] and held by a [[scrunchie]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[white shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar|blue collar]] and a yellow [[neckerchief]], and blue [[shorts]].  She also wears [[black_thighhighs|black]] [[thighhighs]].  

Her [[rigging]] consists of a pair of 203 mm twin gun mounts carried on a strap like a purse on her right, with a [[flight deck]] on her left.  On her back, she carries a mockup of the real ship's bridge like a backpack.  

In the "supplementary material for the 2016 anime film":[https://twitter.com/tayotayo1224/status/1518217102226001920], Aoba is revealed to have a second remodel/kai ni, but remains unimplemented in-game due to her original artist [[Hatsuko]] no longer in touch with C2 Kikan since 2015. Her kai ni transforms her back rig to her real-life bridge superstructure with a mast, a crane on the left/portside, and a catapult on the right/starboard. Her two 20.3 cm twin mounts are also remounted to a new portable rig similar to [[Kinugasa Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]. In addition, she also gains a third 20.3 cm twin mount attached to the left side of her shorts. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #1964044

h4. Personality and history

The historical Aoba famously had a war correspondent onboard, and as such, Aoba has been made out into being the "reporter shipgirl.":/pools/8444 At best, this makes her optimistic and enthusiastic, but at worst, she's portrayed as a stalker or paparazzi (whether she's portrayed as one or the other is largely artist- and/or story-dependent).  (In fact, due to the heavy overlap of artists between [[Touhou]] and Kantai Collection, she's oftentimes just drawn by former Touhou artists as [[Shameimaru Aya]] with the serial numbers filed off, due to the shared reporter stereotypes.) 

Historically, [i]IJN Aoba[/i] was the flagship of Cruiser Division 6, which consisted of her sister ship, [i][[Kinugasa (kancolle)|Kinugasa]][/i], as well as [i][[Furutaka (kancolle)|Furutaka]][/i] and [i][[Kako (kancolle)|Kako]][/i]. She served in numerous naval battles like Coral Sea and Leyte Gulf before being sunk in an air raid in Kure in July 1945.  

h4. [i]Aoba[/i]-class Heavy Cruisers
* [b]Aoba[/b]
* [[Kinugasa (Kancolle)]]

h4. See also
* [[Aoba (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Aoba[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_cruiser_Aoba]

title: yuru_yuri
body:
A manga series by [[namori]], serialized in Comic YuriHime since 2008, and adapted into an anime in the Summer of 2011. A second anime season was released in the summer of 2012. An OVA titled Yuruyuri Nachu Yachumi! was released in 2014. During a event related to OVA's release a 3rd season was announced to be come in production early 2015. The third season, called "YuruYuri San Hai!", aired in October 2015.

Yuru Yuri follows the everyday life of schoolgirls at a fictitious junior high school. The year before the series starts, [[Toshinou Kyouko]] and [[Funami Yui]] take over the former room of the school's Tea Ceremony Club to form the Amusement Club. When Kyouko and Yui's friend [[Akaza Akari]] enters their school, she immediately becomes part of the club. One of Akari's classmates [[Yoshikawa Chinatsu]] also ends up joining the club. Members of the student council often visit the club.

Spin-offs have been made: [[Oomuro-ke]], [[Risetto!]], [[Touzainanboku!]] and [[Tensei Shitara Akari dake ga Slime Datta Ken]].

title: queendom_(tv_series)
body:
Queendom is a South Korean reality compition series created by [[Mnet]]. Each season has 6 big name female [[k-pop]] acts (primarily girl groups, but also soloists) compete with the winning act receiving a televised comeback concert. 

h4. Participating Acts

title: shiniyuku_kimi_yakata_ni_mebuku_zouo
body:
"Shiniyuku Kimi, Yakata ni Mebuku Zouo" is an adult visual novel game set in a mysterious mansion filled with dark secrets.
The story revolves around a protagonist who becomes entangled in a web of hatred and despair within the mansion.
As the narrative unfolds, players must navigate complex relationships and uncover hidden truths, all while dealing with intense emotions and psychological horror. 
The game is known for its dark themes, intricate storytelling, and atmospheric setting.

title: bullpup
body:
A type of non-handgun [[gun|firearm]] configuration where the action is located behind the trigger group/housing and alongside the shooter's face, instead of in front as in conventional designs. This permits the [[weapon]] to be shorter for the same barrel length, improving maneuverability and reducing weight.

Basically, in a normal gun, the [[magazine (weapon)|]] is in front and the trigger is behind. In a bullpup firearm, the trigger is in front and the magazine is behind.

h4. Examples

* !post #6836035

title: looking_to_the_side
body: When a character's gaze is directed to something off to their side. Most commonly are eyes looking 90 degrees across the shoulder, but may also include up to 45 degrees facing in either direction. [[Looking to the side]] is relative to the character's front, not the viewer's perspective. If the eyes are directed more than 45 degrees backwards use [[looking back]] instead. If the character looks to the side without moving their head, combine with [[sideways glance]]. Not to be confused with [[averting eyes]], where someone deliberately diverts their gaze from the viewer/others out of [[embarrassed|embarrassment]] , [[angry|anger]], [[annoyed|annoyance]], etc. h4. Examples * !post #5121424 * !post #2676360 * !post #3013073 h4. See also * [[looking ahead]] * [[looking at viewer]] * [[looking up]] * [[looking down]] * [[looking back]] * [[shaft look]] * [[sideways glance]]

body:

Garter belts are distinct from [[legwear garter]]s, which are worn around the leg to hold up legwear.

Note: Do not use [[garter straps]] with this tag. If only the straps are visible, use [[garter straps]] instead. If both the straps and the belt are visible, use [[garter belt]].

title: playboy_bunny
body:
A character wearing a Playboy bunny outfit, also known as a "bunnysuit" or a "bunny girl".

A stereotypical Playboy bunny outfit consists of a [[black leotard|black]] [[strapless leotard]], [[fake animal ears|fake]] [[rabbit ears]], a [[fake tail|fake]] [[rabbit tail]], [[wrist cuffs]], a [[detached collar]] with a [[bowtie]], [[fishnet pantyhose]] or [[fishnet thighhighs|thighhighs]], and [[high heels]]. Common variations include different outfit colors, or omission of some or all of the accessories.

A [b]Playboy Bunny[/b] was originally a cocktail [[waitress]] who worked at a [[Playboy]] Club. The first Playboy Bunny costume was introduced when Hugh Hefner opened his first Playboy Club in Chicago in 1960. 

h4. Examples

* !post #3072582
* !post #7976767
* !post #6813501

h4. Related tags

* [[playboy bunny swimsuit]] - swimsuit variant
* [[reverse bunnysuit]] - variant where limbs are covered but torso is not
* [[translucent bunnysuit]] - variant with see-through strip down middle of leotard

On retrofit, she has [[purple eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She trades her dress top and black skirt for a proper [[white dress]], her green hair ribbon for a black one, rudder footwear for white [[Mary Janes]], and torpedoes for [[depth charge]]s.

Despite retaining her Royal Navy ship's badge and insignia, her retrofit is supposed to represent her late-war guise as [i]HMCS Saskatchewan[/i], a Canadian destroyer.

title: kursk_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of [i]Kursk[/i], a Soviet heavy cruiser design that was meant as an aircraft-carrying cruiser.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] with [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[red eyes]], [[horns]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is a [[white coat]], [[two-tone dress]] with a [[side slit]], and [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]].

In real life, she was the "Project X":[https://twitter.com/HeraldPOfficial/status/1637764168983126016] derivative of a prior heavy cruiser design with larger guns than the treaty standard while also carrying a large seaplane complement, similar to [[Mogami (Azur Lane)|]] and the [i]Tone[/i]-class of Japan. Records suggest this was due to Soviet espionage of Japanese naval activities, yet the project never got beyond planning stage.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6164202: Default

title: chousoku_spinner

title: hai_tien_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Chinese protected cruiser [i]Hai Tien[/i].  Her name (海天) means "Heavenly Seas".

Historically, she and her sister ship [[Hai Chi (Azur Lane)|]] were the largest ships China had for several decades (compare their 4,300 tons while [[Ning Hai (Azur Lane)|]] had a displacement of 2,500 tons). She was originally commissioned in 1899 and ran aground in 1904 while navigating to the Yangtze in foggy conditions.

In Azur Lane, she and her sister [i]Hai Chi[/i] are reclassed as light cruisers to conform to existing gameplay ship types.

h4. Appearance

title: forza
body:
A series of [[car]] [[racing]] games published by [[Microsoft]] for the Xbox family of consoles, and later for [[computer|PC]].

The series is considered a "simcade", encouraging realistic driving styles but with enough leniency to be accessible to beginners and casual players. Forza is particularly notable for being one of the first racing franchises to feature an in-depth decal and livery customizer, making intricate custom [[racecar]] and [[itasha]] designs prevalent in the series.

The franchise is split into two sub-series - Motorsport and Horizon. The Motorsport games feature closed-track racing on a mix of real and original [[racetrack]]s with cars varying from everyday road cars to [[Le Mans prototype]]s and [[formula racer]]s. The Horizon games are open-world games set at music/motorsports festivals in scenic locations throughout the world, primarily featuring production cars.

h4. Entries

* [[Forza Motorsport 3]]
* [[Forza Motorsport (2023)]]
* [[Forza Horizon 4]]
* [[Forza Horizon 5]]

title: marriage_certificate
body:
A marriage certificate between two characters. It originated as a [[meme]] template on Pixiv, likely as one of their many exercises in creativity.

All tagged entries involve the use of a template:

* Pictures of the groom (left) and bride (right)
* Names of the groom (left) and bride (right), including both kanji reading and pronunciations where possible
* Date of Birth of groom (left) and bride (right)
* A brief description of how the couple first met
* Occupation of groom (left) and bride (right)
* Miscellaneous other comments from the couple and/or any witnesses (friends, family, enemies, etc.)
* Signature and hanko stamp of husband (left) and wife (right). Also acceptable are fingerprints, personal logos, bloodstains, etc. A simple signature is fine if nothing else will do.

h4. See also
* [[Marriage certificate (object)]], when a marriage certificate appears as an object in an image.

title: huadian
body:
Traditional Chinese makeup, which may be located on the [[forehead mark|forehead]], [[mark_between_eyes|between the eyebrows]], the [[marking on cheek|cheeks]], the temples,  and/or the [[dimple facial mark|dimples]].

Also known as: huazi, mianhua, meizi, Shouyang makeup, and plum blossom makeup.

Huadian were historically worn by women - however, in fantasy depictions based in China, or with Chinese themes, there are depictions of men with similar  or identical markings. This is used sometimes - though not always - as an indicator of supernatural abilites, deity status, or other non-human traits. This may derive from Buddhist influence, with an example being Nezha (哪吒), a male diety from Chinese and Indian mythology, or Erlang Shen, of whom is sometimes depicted with his third eye as a [[forehead mark]].

h4.See Also
* [[Bindi]] (Hindu forehead mark)

body:

Contrary to [[punching]], a slap is mostly used to punish, wake up, stimulate or humiliate rather than harm another person. This is why it is mostly used by girlfriends, sergeants, bosses, [[bdsm]] partners, parents and teachers.

Very common in certain cultures, like [[Japan]].

title: carl_clover
body:
[[BlazBlue]] character.

Carl Clover is a young vigilante who dropped out of the Military Academy. 

A talented young boy and first class vigilante, Carl has brought many criminals to justice with the aid of his mysterious doll Nirvana, which he believes to be his elder sister, Ada Clover. Carl heads to Kagutsuchi to retrieve the bounty for [[Ragna the Bloodedge]]. He is a former classmate of [[Noel vermillion]], [[Jin Kisaragi]], [[Makoto Nanaya]], and [[Tsubaki Yayoi]] when they were in the Military Academy, but he dropped out. Carl wants to get revenge on his father [[Relius Clover]], for what he did to Carl's older sister, Ada. In some part of his story, Carl meets [[Shishigami Bang]], and Bang calls him his "cute little disciple". 

He is voiced by [[Sawashiro Miyuki]].

title: marching_band
body:
A group in which [[instrument]]al musicians perform for entertainment, celebration or a competition while marching. Most marching bands wear a [[band uniform]], often of a [[military uniform|military style]] with a [[shako cap]] as marching bands have a close association with the military in the history, which helps to tell them apart from generic musical ensembles.

h4.See also

* [[band uniform]]
* [[majorette]]
* [[marching band baton]]
* [[orchestra]]

title: band_uniform
body:
A uniform worn by members of a group of musicians. The outfits are embellished in bright colors, and a [[shako cap]] is a huge staple of the uniform. Women wear short pleated skirts.

h4. See also

* [[marching band]]
* [[List of Uniforms]]

In her retrofit form, the rigging now has a more open spacing for greater movement, all four gun mounts are now present, the lower gun mounts are realigned perpendicular to the superfiring ones, and she gains two quad 533 mm [[torpedo tubes]], one per side. She also discards the black [[detached sleeves]] from base form and opts instead for metallic [[wrist cuffs]].

title: zhou_yaqin_learns_medal_biting_(meme)
body:
A viral photos originated from the [[2024 Summer Olympics]] women's team balance gymnastic event medal ceremony.

The photos featuring Chinese silver medalist [[Zhou Yaqin]] looking at the Italian gold medalist [[Alice D'Amato]] and her bronze medalist compatriot [[Manila Esposito]] [[biting]] their [[medal]]s, as she is unaware of the medal biting tradition of the event. Zhou would later replicate the act after some encouragement from Alice and Manila.

title: friends_(tv_series)
body:
[b]Friends[/b] was an American sitcom that aired for over ten seasons from September 22, 1994, to May 6, 2004. The show, staring Jennifer Aniston, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc, Matthew Perry and David Schwimmer, follows six friends in their 20s to early 30s and their lives in Manhattan, New York City.

The show was a big hit when it aired, winning several awards including Six Emmys, with its final episode being the most watch finale in 2004.

title: aya_(project_moon)
body:
A character in [[Limbus Company]], appearing in Canto I.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] with [[sidelocks]], an [[ahoge]], and has an [[x hair ornament]]. In canon, she has her [[closed eyes|eyes closed]] more often than not, but they are revealed to be [[yellow eyes|yellow]]. She wears a black-and-white [[jacket]] with [[blue trim|blue-trimmed]] [[lapels]] and a matching [[blue scarf]], along with [[black pants]] with a [[red belt|red]] [[thigh belt]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She uses an [[energy weapon|energy-based]] [[shotgun]] in combat.

Her outfit notably mirrors her coworker, [[Yuri (project moon)|]]'s, which inverts the red and blue.

h4. See also
* [[Hopkins (project moon)|]]
* [[Yuri (project moon)|]]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]

title: hopkins_(project_moon)
body:
A character in [[Limbus Company]], appearing in Canto I.

He has [[short hair|short]], [[messy hair|messy]] [[brown hair]] and [[aqua eyes]] behind [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[glasses]]. He wears the uniform of his Fixer Office, wearing a black-and-white [[jacket]] with [[blue trim|blue-trimmed]] [[lapels]], [[black pants]] with a [[blue belt|blue]] [[thigh belt]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. His version of the uniform has a prominent [[high collar]] that reaches his chin, and he uses a [[crossbow]] as his weapon, with the [[quiver]] hanging on his lower back.

title: hayate_no_gotoku!
body:
A [i]Weekly Shounen Sunday[/i] manga series by [[Hata Kenjirou]], with an accompanying light novel series written by Tsukiji Toshihiko, and an anime adaptation by Synergy SP (Season 1) and [[J.C. Staff]] (Season 2) with the third season being produced by Manglobe, titled [i]Can't Take My Eyes Off You[/i]. The fourth season is titled [i]Cuties[/i], also by Manglobe.

[[Ayasaki Hayate]] is an unlucky boy forced into paying off debts by his extremely irresponsible parents. After running from home once they went too far, Hayate met [[Sanzen'in Nagi]], an extremely spoiled, sheltered heiress, who offers him a job as her butler. Together with Nagi's personal maid [[Maria (hayate no gotoku!)|]], Hayate and his employer get into several misadventures.

title: sumitomo_ntk-62
body:
The standard issue 7.62×51mm NATO general-purpose [[machine gun]] of the Japan Self-Defense Forces. Also known as the Type 62 GPMG. When first issued it fulfilled both light and medium machine gun support throughout the JGSDF.

Though the "Sumitomo Heavy Industries":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumitomo_Heavy_Industries]-produced [[M249 SAW]] firing the smaller 5.56×45mm NATO cartridge has largely replaced it in the light machine gun role at the squad level in the [[japan ground self-defense force|JGSDF]], the NTK-62 still plays the support role at platoon and company level for the infantry as a medium machine gun firing the more powerful [[ammunition|cartridge]]. It also continues to be used as a co-axial weapon in various armored vehicles, including [[tank]]s and [[armored personnel carrier|APC]]s. Like all modern Japanese-made [[gun|firearms]], it was never exported.

h4. See also

* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Type 62 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sumitomo Type 62":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumitomo_Type_62
* "Special ops.org: Sumitomo Type 62":https://special-ops.org/sumitomo-ntk-62-machine-gun/

title: adventurer_(ff14)
body:
The Midlander [[Hyur]] who acts as a poster boy for [[Final Fantasy XIV]], also known as the [[Warrior of Light (ff14)|]]. Called many names by fans, whether it be "Hiroshi" by the Japanese (after Director "NQ" Hiroshi Takai), or by English speakers "Meteor" (from Meteor Survivor), "CG Midlander", or even "Derplander" affectionately.

Shown in different Jobs in each installment:
* Final Fantasy XIV 1.0: Gladiator/Archer
* A Realm Reborn: [[Warrior (final fantasy)|]]
* Heavensward: [[Dragoon (final fantasy)|]]
* Stormblood: [[Monk (final fantasy)|]]/[[Samurai (final fantasy)|]]
* Shadowbringers: [[Dark Knight (final fantasy)|]]
* Endwalker: [[Paladin (final fantasy)|]]
* Dawntrail: [[Viper (final fantasy)|]]

For player created adventurers, use [[Warrior of Light (ff14)|]] only.

title: yi_sang_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus company]] character. 

Sinner No.01 of [[Limbus Company]]. Named and based on both the 20th century Korean poet "Kim Hae-Gyeong":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yi_Sang and the protagonist of their novel "The Wings":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wings_(novel). 

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[black eyes]] with noticeable [[bags under eyes|bags]], an almost permanently [[exhausted]] expression, and carries a [[satchel]] containing a [[book]] and [[dagger]] across all of his identities. He wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], and a [[black coat]] he wears [[coat on shoulders|over his shoulders]]. 

He primarily wields a [[dagger|saingeom]] in his base identity, and carries a [[book]] and [[satchel]] bag labeled with the Korean name '하융' ('Ha Yong', a pseudonym used by Kim Hae-Gyeong) across all of his identities.

h4. Official art

* !post #5026033

title: skeletal_hand
body: A hand that consists exclusively of bone, while other parts of the body consist of flesh or even [[mechabare]].

title: car_part
body:
A visible mechanical part (or multiple parts) of a [[car]], such as an [[engine]] or its part, a [[turbocharger]], a brake disc, transmission etc, excluding [[wheel]]s and fasteners ([[bolt (hardware)|]]s, [[screw]]s and [[nut (hardware)|nut]]s). The parts may be either removed from a car, or be installed on it, but be visible enough to properly identify, such as under the open hood, or exposed by design (such as in post #5877255).

Vehicle body parts (bumpers, fenders etc) count too, as long as they are removed from the vehicle at least partially.

Not to be confused with the similar tag [[mechabare]], which should be used for [[android]]s, [[mecha]]s and other robot-like characters.

Related Twitter tags: #むき出しのエンジンを見せてもっと

[i]TBD: create a broader tag vehicle_part, which would include tanks, rail vehicles, etc.[/i]

title: mechanical_pussy
body:
The character is a [[cyborg]] or [[android]] with mechanical, robotic or [[mechabare|cybernetic]] [[pussy|female genitalia]], the nature of which is obvious, for example, if the character is partially [[disassembly|disassembled]], [[damaged]], shown through an [[x-ray]], or an organ has undeniable external signs of artificial origin. At a minimum, if the genital module has a visible border on the skin, separating it from the rest of the body.
Also suitable for single images of cybernetic or robotic female genitalia intended to be mounted as part of a [[robot]], [[android]] or [[cyborg]] body.
The tag is not used for an [[artificial vagina]], which is just a [[sex toy]].
The tag is not relevant if the artificial nature of the [[pussy]] is implied by the nature of the character, but not visually.

title: skeletal_arm
body: An arm that consists exclusively of bone, while other parts of the body consist of flesh or even [[mechabare]].

title: parts_exposed
body: See [[mechabare]].

title: plastic_skin
body:
Some or all of the character's skin is made of plastic. As a [[metal skin]], a common feature of many [[cyborg]]s and [[android]]s that are not designed to look convincingly human, and is also common to some [[doll]]s and other similar creatures.

Plastic skin can be painted in a natural color, but differ in [[shiny skin|shine]] and the presence of [[joints]], or have any other colors. Most often white, gray or black.

Don't use this tag for characters that canonically have [[metal skin]] unless it actually appears to be made of plastic.

This tag shouldn't be used for non-humanoid [[robot]]s since they aren't typically meant to have "skin" anyway.

h4.See also

* [[mechabare]]
* [[robot joints]]
* [[doll joints]]
* [[shiny skin]]

title: proto_miku_(cheri_zao)
body:
A derivative of [[Vocaloid]] [[Hatsune Miku]] by [[Cheri Zao]]. A supposed prototype of Miku, which looks more like an [[android]] or [[robot girl]] with more mechanical features, including [[cable hair]], [[robot joints]], and generally more [[mechabare]].

* !post #6253058: First post
* !post #6306154: Blueprints

h4. See also

* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: metal_skin
body:
Some or all of of a character's skin is made of metal. A common feature of many [[cyborg|cyborgs]] and [[android|androids]] that aren't designed to look convincingly human, but it may also be the case with non-mechanical beings such as certain [[golem|golems]] or [[elemental_(creature)|elementals]].

Don't use this tag unless the skin actually appears to be made of metal. Seams, overlapping plates, and a lustrous finish are valid reasons to use this tag. Skin that is simply grey or yellow is not; that's what the [[grey skin]] and [[yellow skin]] tags are for. Shiny coverings that aren't actually metal might be [[scales]] or a [[carapace]].

This tag shouldn't be used for non-humanoid [[robot]]s or [[mecha]] since they aren't typically meant to have "skin" anyway.

h4.See also

* [[exoskeleton]]
* [[mecha musume]]
* [[mechabare]]
* [[robot joints]]
* [[shiny skin]]
* [[tag group:skin color]]

title: erlking_heathcliff_(project_moon)
body:
[spoiler] A Mirror World version of [[Heathcliff (project moon)|]], who after the death of his version of [[Catherine (project moon)|]] went mad with grief and resolved to kill every [[Heathcliff (project moon)|]] in every Mirror World. He is one of the primary antagonists of Canto VI.[/spoiler]

He has a generally [[disheveled]] appearance, with [[messy hair|messy]] [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]] and [[dark skin]] featuring [[scar|scars]]. He wears a [[brown coat|brown]] [[overcoat]] over a [[black vest|black]] [[waistcoat]], accessorized with two [[shoulder belt|shoulder belts]] and one [[high belt]], along with [[brown pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. He also wears a [[half capelet]], a [[scarf]], and leather [[gauntlets]].

[spoiler]He initially disguises himself as Matthew, the boss of the Dead Rabbits and [[Heathcliff (project moon)|]]'s former friend.
Erlking Heathcliff is erased from history with the deletion of Catherine and is not playable. His playable equivalent is [[Wuthering Heights (identity) (project moon)|Wild Hunt Heathcliff]], who can be differentiated from him by having an [[eyepatch]].[/spoiler]

title: hatake_kakashi
body: A supporting character in [[Naruto]]. An elite ninja who trained [[Uzumaki Naruto]], [[Uchiha Sasuke]] and [[Haruno Sakura]]. He is the rival of [[Might Guy]] but does not seem to take him very seriously...

title: inoue_takina
body:
A character in [[Lycoris Recoil]].

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with [[bangs]]. She wears the [[lycoris uniform]] that consists of a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[blue dress|blue]] & [[grey dress|grey]] [[pleated dress]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[green ribbon|green]] [[neck ribbon]], and a [[blue belt]]. She also wears [[black male underwear|black]] [[boxers]] for underwear, though she later switches to wearing [[black shorts|black]] [[shorts under dress|shorts under her dress]] (but not as underwear).

Her cafe attire, where she works as a [[waitress]], consists of a [[blue kimono]], [[yellow bow|yellow]] [[waist bow]], and an [[apron]]. She styles her hair in [[twintails]].

Usually depicting [[holding gun|holding a gun]] with [[trigger discipline]].

h4. See Also

* "Lycoris Recoil Wiki: Inoue Takina":https://lycoris-recoil.fandom.com/wiki/Takina_Inoue

title: nishikigi_chisato
body:
A character in [[Lycoris Recoil]] and said to be the strongest Lycoris of all time.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] to [[white hair]] stylized in a [[bob cut]] with [[bangs]]. She wears a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]] and the [[lycoris uniform]] that consists of a [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[red dress|red]] & [[grey dress|grey]] [[pleated dress]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[neck ribbon]], and a [[red belt]].

Her cafe attire, where she works as a [[waitress]], consists of a [[red kimono]], [[green bow|green]] [[waist bow]], and an [[apron]].

Usually depicting [[holding gun|holding a gun]] with [[trigger discipline]], and an [[Heart|Artificial Heart]]. Seems to be a devotee of the [[center axis relock stance]].

She is voiced by [[Anzai Chika]].

h4. See Also

* "Lycoris Recoil Wiki: Nishikigi Chisato":https://lycoris-recoil.fandom.com/wiki/Chisato_Nishikigi
* "Wikipedia: Chisato Nishikigi":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chisato_Nishikigi

title: nondi_(owonekko)
body:
Nondi is an OC, by the YouTube digital artist, OwOnekko.

Nondi is also called Boobah in the official OwOnekko YouTube/Unvale account. 

Nondi is a "dwarf":[/wiki_pages/dwarf]; that has an appearance of: empty eyes (no iris/pupils), half naked (sweater is the only piece of clothing they have), and a fish themed outfit. 

[i]Not to be confused with boobs.[i]

title: ouendan
body:
A traditional sports rally team in Japan. While it is basically doing the same thing as  [[cheerleader|cheerleading]] does, it places more emphasis on making noise than on any acrobatics. Many posts either reference this or what some ouendan members are wearing: [[gakuran]] - long sleeved coats, headbands called [[hachimaki]], an armband, and sometimes gloves.

h4. Example
* !post #7552466
* !post #152366
* !post #74697: waving a flag
* !post #5357306: holding a flag

title: demon's_souls
body:
[b]Demon's Souls[/b] is a 2009 action role-playing game developed by [[fromsoftware|FromSoftware]] for the PlayStation 3 under the supervision of Japan Studio. It was published in Japan by [[sony|Sony Computer Entertainment]] in February, in North America by [[atlus|Atlus USA]] in October, and in PAL territories by [[bandai namco|Namco Bandai Partners]] in June 2010. The game was made as a spiritual successor to FromSoftware's [[King's Field]] series. Later it would received its own successor in the [[Dark Souls (series)|Dark Souls trilogy]].

It was remade in 2020 for the PS5 by Bluepoint Games.

title: bee_wings
body:
Found often on [[bee girl]]s, they are often simplified to rounded, [[transparent_wings|transparent]], small wings. Unlike [[dragonfly wings]] and other types of [[insect wings]] they are a single pair, though [[flapping]] might give the illusion of a double pair.

title: enna_alouette
body:
A [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual youtuber]], part of the third wave [[Ethyria]] and designed by [[KT. (Kaisou-Notagui)|Kaisou-Notagui]].

Enna is a [[small breasts|small-breasted]] [[angel]] [[bird girl]] with [[purple eyes|purple]] [[multicolored eyes|and]] [[yellow eyes]] with [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long hair]] that [[gradient hair|gradients between]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[multicolored hair|and]] [[blue hair|blue]]. Most of the time she also wears a number of [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower|flowers]] and [[purple bow|purple bows]] on [[hair bow|her hair]]. Hair hairstyle is composed of [[low twintails|low twintails]], [[bangs]] and [[ahoge]]. Outside of a pair of [[purple wings|purple]] [[head wings|head wings]] on her head, she also has another pair of wings out on her back, one of which is a normal [[white wings|white wing]], another is a [[mechanical wings|mechanical]], prosthetic wing that she got after "the accident":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoodleIncident.

h4. Costumes

h5. Official costumes with a model

* !post #4832540: [[Enna Alouette (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #5859439: [[Enna Alouette (2nd costume)|2nd costume]]: Queen of Spades
* !post #6965196: [[Enna Alouette (3rd costume)|3rd costume]]: Zuttoღo Fall

h5. Costumes shared with other members

* !post #6932340: NijiFes: Group Green

h4. Nijisanji units and groups

* [[Ethyria]] (debut)
* [[Zuttomo (Nijisanji)|Zuttoღo/NijiUK]] (casual)

title: 3d_printer
body: A [b]3D-printer[/b] is a [[machine]] that performs the creation of a physical object from a three-dimensional digital model, typically by laying down many thin layers of a material in succession. A 3D-printer can be recognized by its parts such as its print bed, axis motors
